title: Don’t recommend it
text: Unless you’re a 20 year old, I don’t recommend staying here. Rooms are so small, even by NYC standards. No space to put anything; literally  not a drawer for a single item of clothes. Staff is nice and lounge is fine. But the rooms are not comfortable in any way. I’m a gold elite member and was “upgraded”. Can’t imagine what a non upgraded room was like.

title: Evacuated from Building Fire Alarm - Three (3) Star Review for Three Star Hotel
text:
Objectively this is NOT a 4-star hotel and falls closer to a 3-star (not to be confused with reviews, rather the caliber of the hotel, what’s offered amenity-wise and the service level). Totally miscategorized on Google and TripAdvisor. Simply bc you have sexy interiors with dark colors, neon signs, and a taxidermy bear doesn’t make you 4 stars. Don’t get me wrong, was it barely an OK value cost-wise as we received a killer rate through our company? sure, but that was the only saving grace. Location is actually very great with good restaurants nearby. Tack on the ‘destination’ fee of $25 a day (check in staff did not explain what this fee can be used for) and I would rather spend slightly more for a much more comfortable experience elsewhere. 

While lots of companies get discounts here this hotel is not a conducive working place. Sure, throw on your noise canceling headphones since it’s loud in the main area and forget about taking meetings in your margarita stained fabric chair. I had to take calls in the bball court!

This is an INCREDIBLY bare bones hotel, where you get towels, hand soap, a combo hair+body wash (never a good sign of quality) and conditioner. From traveling around the world, this was the first time I was given plastic cups for our bathroom (how is this 4-stars)? Rooms are TINY for 2 people, folding desk could barely fit a MacBook Pro and some notepads, highly uncomfortable folding chair for working, no closet. Forget about using the room as an office. Hotel room itself was generally clean, with some slight wear and tear. Bed was surprisingly comfortable, pillows not so great. King rooms are RV Kings (ya the ones you buy for a mobile home) they’re 4 in. in width smaller than standard king. 

Sure, is it cool place to grab drinks a few nights, play skeeball and basketball, ya, but it’s really a club like atmosphere which seems more attractive to those looking to party than to work. Gym is bare bones, there’s no bench for back/chest exercises, no cable system but you do get Peleton and treadmills. 

Hotel staff are actually more friendly than described in reviews and the way I see it is these poor souls are over worked and over stretched running around trying to mend the shortcomings from Marriott/corporate under investing in this hotel. Example, right after jumping in the shower the fire alarm goes off and NYFD came. Smoke billowing through the small lobby. Turns out oil was spilling everywhere in the elevator engine room — complete negligence and shows how things like routine maintenance inspections are overlooked at this hotel. 

Hotel seems like a selfie millennial money grab (ironically I’m a millennial) that cuts corners to save money, you have to ask for turn down service, robs of basic amenities like a hot water kettle, no options for q-tips, shower caps, etc and moisturizer and no proper office desk, ignores core principles of hospitality and the focus is on maximizing capitalism and OpEx than comfort and business users.

title: Fun, Upbeat and a Genuine Team!
text:
Had a great experience staying at the Moxy NYC Downtown. Upon my arrival, I was immediately welcomed by team members working the front desk and door. Later utilized the restaurant/lounge to get some work done  where they played some of my favorite jams, had entertaining games such as shuffleboard, oversized tic tac toe, skeeball, as well as a basketball court and foosball in a room on the other end. 

A visit to their gym included several Pelotons, treadmills and free weights. 

The food was average but they made up for it with excellent team members like Majed (server), Tyra (server) and Laura (hostess) who regularly check up on guests and made their best efforts to make sure their guests were well taken care of and even engaged in conversation. 

Definitely will revisit in the future and hope to be welcomed and see the outstanding team members Majed, Tyra and Laura that I was able to meet during my quick trip to Manhattan! Anthony (team lead/manager), your team was outstanding and look forward to see you all in the near future!

title: Clever, comfortable NYC hotel
text:
Great stay at this hotel. 

I was visiting Pace University with my daughter. We've stayed in several Moxy's by now and,  as with all the others, this property is just flat-out cool. Cleverly designed common spaces, modern yet comfy rooms, really nice and capable staff. A couple hours after checking out, I realized I didn't have my sunglasses. The manager Zhan gave me a new room key and welcomed me to go ahead back up to the room to look for them. When I returned to the front desk bc that room key wouldn't work, Zhan started to issue me yet another new key. Then he stopped himself and said he would just take me up himself. I appreciated his consideration. No sunglasses, but an enjoyable conversation about NYC and how good Moxy is as an employer. 

Zhan the manager was great, the bar/food staff were friendly and greeted us like we were old friends by the second day. We go to NYC from time to time and we'll be for a lot more if my daughter chooses Pace U. We'll  definitely be staying at this Moxy again.

title: Best value in Manhattan
text: This is my second time staying at the Moxy downtown.  As a New Yorker enduring the winter here I like to get creative and do a “staycation” in a different area of manhattan and love choosing FiDi/Seaport.  The Moxy is by far the best deal if you’re visiting from out of town and want to be steps from every major subway line, near all of the major destinations and have a plethora of wonderful dining options within two blocks.  The hotel itself is high on design making NYC standard sized rooms creative and livable.  The 3rd floor is massive and fun with a live DJ on the weekends, great bar, Basketball court, air hockey etc etc. great space to have friends come and join.  The hotel staff from Justin at check-in to food and bev and crew go above and beyond! All were accommodating and lovely to me and my service dog.  If you’re coming to NYC and want the absolute best value while still staying in a chic hotel that’s safe, convenient and views for days forget staying in midtown and come here

title: Absolutely waste of time and unhelpful
text:
DAYUSE = NO USE - This has been an absolute disaster!! A wasted 90 dollar ride into nyc from the airport to get to this hotel who didn’t have my reservation ready!! 
I booked 10-4 pm as need to leave 4pm and go back to airport! 
Wasted an expensive taxi ride to get there at 10.45 just for them to say they don’t have a room for my reservation ready, do I wanna wait??? So what is going on!??? 6hr time booking and you want me to wait. I came here to sleep and booked it to do that! Not wait till a room is ready!!

Am I supposed to wait and still pay full price for less hrs sleep ?? Yes apparently 

This was booked thru DAYUSE, and now I have no where to sleep for the few hrs I need and paid for taxi 90 dollars to get to this stupid hotel. 

What is going on!? Wasting my time and money !!! 

Worst of all you shouldn’t be selling rooms that you don’t have!  And least of all your staff just said … do you wanna try find yourself somewhere other hotel! 

Wasted taxi fare to this awful place!

title: Great stay!
text: My mom and I recently stayed here for a little getaway.  Every single staff member that we encountered was extremely friendly and helpful.  Very good location, with a nearby subway entrance and walking distance to many attractions including Wall Street, 9/11 Memorial and the Statue of Liberty.  The hotel is great, but the staff is what really puts it over the top!

title: Over charged and can’t get through to anyone at the property. On hold on the phone for over an hour.
text: The check in and stay were actually great. The front desk staff at check in was extremely helpful (Corday?). Room was very small but fine for my one night stay. I got a pre-bill emailed to me before I checked out and it wasn’t right. I booked the room on the hotel tonight app so room and tax were paid for. I was prepared to pay the ‘destination charge’ of $28 directly to the hotel. When I mentioned this at the FD at checkout I was flippantly told that the pre-bill was wrong and it would be fixed in the final bill. I got the final bill after I left the property and it was still wrong. I tried to call the hotel 6 times. Two of the times I waited on hold for close to 30 min. I hung up both times and tried to call back. The person answering the phone wouldn’t let me expalain that I had been waiting on hold for over an hour combined. They just kept answering and immediately putting the call on hold so that I couldn’t get a word in. There should be a way to talk to someone at the hotel without waiting on hold for that long. Or maybe provide an email address so that the request can be sent electronically and dealt with when there is time. Terrible customer service and that has ruined the entire stay for me and I still don’t have resolution for the over billing.

title: WORST TABLE AND ROOM SERVICE EVER.. FELT LIKE A SCAM
text:
I understand that Newyork is know worldwide for being a tourist trap where they just want to scam your money away, but this is ridiculous.
Arrived on the 22nd after 8 hours flight, rooms are unbelievably small with no closet, literally two little stools where to put clothes. No even complimentary water (you will be charged 6$ if you happen to be thirsty after 8 hours flight).
THIS IS NOT THE WORST PART
After couple of days we asked to get our room cleaned the next day and , after being out for like all day, we came back and the room was left exactly how it was. We had to call at 11pm to get fresh towel to have a shower!! The reception didn't have an explanation for that and luckily they managed to clean it next room.

I work in hospitality and I can tell, this is ABSOLUTELY WORST TABLE /BAR WHATEVER YOU WANT TO PUT IT SERVICE.
DON'T GET BREAKFAST IN THE HOTEL IF YOU HAVE PLANS FOR THE MORNING!!
 Very rude and stressed waiters, breakfast absolutely overcharged and with minimum waiting time of 30/40 MINS for a sandwich!!

 I HAVE NEVER SEEN A FRONT OF HOUSE SERVICE SO BAD..

It is a shame this being from same Mariott brand since it really lower the name of it.
The worst part is that is classified as 4 STAR HOTEL!!! THIS SHOULD BE BARELY AN HOSTEL, THE FACT IS SUPPOSED TO BE 4 STARS IS UNBELIEVABLE...
Location is good but it's the only part, for everything else is absolutely OVERPRICED AND UNDERTRAINED/RUDE/DON'T CARE STAFF.

title: Outstanding service! Great place.
text: Nice room, surprisingly spacious, comfy beds, good breakfast,  cool, lobby and rec room with great bar, foosball, table, top, shuffleboard, video games, ski ball, all complementary. But most important, the best service I have ever had at any hotel, including the five star ones. Justin at the Front Desk was incredibly nice when we checked in early. Absolutely everyone else who worked there was super helpful, super responsive. Just a real gem review of a hotel.

title: Much better places in NY - scammy charging practices
text:
The rooms are tiny tiny, and they have a couple of tiny folding tables hanging on the wall. 
They will charge you an extra $25+tax per day for destination fee. It's a scammy practice. On top of that they overcharged me for water I never used (I bought warer bottles from the CVS on the corner, but they just saw the bottle and they just charged away).
Getting in touch with them is impossible, nobody ever pick up the phone, I must have called 5 times and waited 30+ minutes. Ended up going via Marriot but still they had to send them a message and wait to respond.
Just save yourself the hassle and go somewhere else

title: Fab Moxy
text: We had a fab overnight stay at this hotel and the staff were so attentive. Elise at reception and others whom I have forgotten their names were excellent.  We will return thank you. The position of the hotel is great and near Broadway and 9/11 Memorial too.

title: Cool Hotel with a Great Manager
text: The hotel was great-   cool interiors, super clean room with luxurious design and a great bathroom.  What inspired this review, however, was the kindness of the manager (I'm sorry I didn't get your name), after an excruciatingly frustrating  mishap occurred with the key to my room that had me in FULL tears.  While I left the hotel vocally upset, I very quickly came to appreciate how incredibly refreshing it was to have a manager take responsibility for his staff, genuinely apologize for the confusion, and make an effort to make it right.  I appreciated that SO much..   and wanted to let you know that.  The date was 12/6.  I hope you are recognized by the company for your humanity and customer service.  Because of you, I will be back to the Moxy Downtown!

title: Unacceptable Level of Service - Selling room when had already been purchased in advance.
text: Extremely dissatisfied with the level of customer service. Room was booked however due to flight delay we called to inform we would not be arriving to the next day. We arrived the next day to be informed our room had been sold to someone else and we would need to re-book another room. How can you sell our room which had been paid for in advance to someone else?! Due to having friends staying at the same hotel we did re-book as we were told we would be refunded for the original booking and revive the room for the same price as originally booked due the error of giving our room to someone else. I made the error of believing the manager and am still waiting for the refund of the room they gave to someone else and to be credited for the extremely inflated price we paid for the other room. The hotel has NOT been responded to emails to resolve this matter, but was happy to receive double payment for a room?! How is this legally allowed. The level of service by the manager at this property is not acceptable. It is unfortunate I am needing to write this review but left with no other option due to lack of response for 3 months.

title: Overwhelming smell of marijuana and not designed for professional business travellers
text:
This hotel is designed for young people visiting NYC, not for professional business travellers. The overwhelming smell of marijuana envelops the entrance reception and does not present the type of experience that you expect when arriving after a long flight to NYC. The rooms are basic and lack basic requirements you expect for a business hotel.
The bathroom was clean and modern however the rooms are small, there was a lack of hanging area for clothes the room had no desk or chair. 
I am sure that this hotel would be suitable for tourists however this hotel was not designed for professional business travellers in mind. 
Furthermore the room was not serviced during the 5 nights of my trip even after requesting this twice. 
I would not recommend or return to this hotel again.

title: Highly recommended.
text:
Great experience. Room was efficiently laid out and nicely renovated. (We have experience with small NYC hotel rooms and this was not the smallest.) Clean, modern, quiet room.
Entrance looks like nothing but then you take an elevator to 3rd floor with large cafe/bar. It had great coffee and breakfast. Was hopping in the evening. Daily destination fee of $25 can be used as credit for food and drinks.

Staff was excellent. Let us check in early.
Hotel is a short block from subway. Would def recommend.

title: Not my hotel
text:
Hotel format is absolutely for young guys or smart people. I’m not the right person for this kind of hotel.
Hall is small and during the check in you’ve to scream to understand what you’ve to do. 
Room is essential without any wardrobe with some rail to learn your dresses 
Room setup is done after the third day. Ti have before you’ve to ask.
It’s not a bad hotel .. it is non for me.

title: Beyond disappointed, do not stay here.
text: VERY DISAPPOINTED. Booked my stay over a month ago and the DAY OF checking in a receive an email that my booking has been canceled and they will be rebooking me elsewhere with no proper explanation. Worst part, a few of of colleagues still had their reservations and when we got to the hotel (i had packages to collect) they offered them UPGRADES, so clearly had rooms. When I asked if I could book a room for the night one of the front desk staff said they had a room available and the other quickly shut him down. All very dogey to me. Will not be giving this place another chance and neither should you!

title: Great hotel
text: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Moxy Downtown. The hotel is beautiful. The lobby looks brand new and is a lot of fun to hang out in. They give everyone a $25 per day credit at the bar/restaurant in the lobby which results in a lot of people hanging out there which is a fun vibe. My room was clean and I liked how it had hardwood floors. Wifi worked very well (even enough to handle intense remote connections for work). The staff was also nice.

title: Moxy DOWNTOWN
text:
Customer service was outstanding!! I wish I remembered all their names. They literally bent over backwards to make sure we were comfortable and enjoyed our stay. 
The hotel is within walking distance to the WTC and 9/11 Memorial. There are also lots of great shops and restaurants in the area. 
We had one rainy day during our stay so we decided to just hang out at the hotel. We had the BEST time. The restaurant has great food options, great drinks, fun games, and great music. At night, the bar really comes alive. When we were tired, we relaxed in the room and enjoyed the amazing view from our room. 
We will definitely stay here again!!!

title: RUDE MANAGEMENT-WOKEN UP BY SECURITY AT 11PM AND CAME DOWN WITH SCABIES
text:
the place is run by a bunch of hooligans--we were woken up at about 11pm with a loud knock on the door claiming that a "silent alarm" went off in our room and engineering was there to fix it --My husband and I do not smoke btw. the next day we got the reasoning behind such an assault was that "we need to catch people in the act" and the general manager said "ah your husband looks strong enough to take him down even if it wasn't truly an engineer from the Marriott". My husband is 65 years of age
We came down with scabies and had to be treated by a physician -she said is is lilkely it came from Moxy

title: Good downtown location, creatively outfitted rooms.
text:
Really appreciated Alex the engineer going above and beyond to fulfill my request - blocking a bright light in my room that for some inexplicable reason does not turn off -  late at night with a smile. Thank you! 

Other than that good experience. Great location. Would love a quieter, more well lit place to converge with coworkers.

title: Trendy hotel with a nice vibe, but high-priced for such tiny rooms
text:
First up, the Moxy doesn't position itself as a business hotel, so my thoughts may differ had I been here for a holiday instead. 

The location is very handy for World Trade Center and the Financial District. There is a reception at ground level and then another on the 3rd floor where the bar and restaurant are located and where guests need to pass through to access the lifts for the rooms.

The bar is lively and a nice spot to meet friends for a casual drink. 

The room itself was very small even by New York standards. The Moxy does a good job of making the most of a tiny space, but hooks rather than a cupboard for clothing, is not ideal if you need to hang a week of clothing, as there's only 3 hangers. There is an iron in a drawer under the bed (along with a safe), however, the board very small and one that needs to be rested on the table, which drops down from the wall. 

The decor is great - and there's a hanging seat next to the bed. And clever use of art and lighting. 

Along with a small room size, I found the noise levels, which I assume was from the rooftop airconditioning which faced my room on level 29, made it hard to sleep even with earplugs. It was a little disappointing to see the spectacular view when getting out of the lift on level 29, and then realize that the room itself just faced aircon units on a nearby rooftop. 

Overall the service is prompt and really friendly. 

Not a top spot for a business traveler, but more style and vivre than many hotels in this part of Manhattan.

title: Top Lage
text: Das Moxy Downtown liegt erstmal in einer Seitenstraße zum WTC. Absolut perfekt für einen Städtetrip! Subway in nächster Nähe! Das Personal war sehr freundlich. Das Zimmer groß genug und sauber! Das Bad für New York gross und auch sehr sauber. Was uns nicht so gefallen hat war die eisige Kälte in der Bar. Aber das empfindet ja auch jeder anders. Und das wir einmal neue Handtücher bestellt hatten, die aber nicht getauscht wurden. Aber alles in allem haben wir uns sehr wohl im Moxy gefühlt und würden auch wieder kommen, sollten wir nochmals nach New York kommen.

title: Wanted to love it but …
text: Was in a prime location for activity we had planned and staff were friendly and responsive but clearly seems like the building has some electrical issues. Lobby restaurant/bar area is a great vibe. Room is very small and shower is not great. All lights went out while in the shower then when they all came back on then nothing in the room could be turned off.  Building maintenance couldn’t even figure out how to get things to work or turn off after climbing into the ceiling of our room at 1am. They manually lowered our blind however had to sleep all night with all lights glaring bright. Room 2911. Now seeing others have had the same issues. Staff seem to be trying their best.

title: Surprise fees
text:
The hotel views customers as an ATM.  

A surprise “Destination Fee” of $50 was added to our rate at checkin with no previous warning.  The fee gave us a credit at the terrible, noisy restaurant on site, free tickets to the Statue of Liberty Ferry and use of bikes.  Our trip was already planned, so the destination fee was pointless.

 In the restaurant every food item was terrible and the restaurant doubles as a disco, so we were not able to talk at dinner.   Furthermore, it was not possible to order 2 menu items within the $25 allowance.  Breakfast was stale croissants and average coffee take out.  We pitched the croissants after one bite.

The little bit of room furniture was chipped up, the automatic window shades did not work, first shower was cold, and the water would not shut off after the shower.  They never cleaned our room or made the bed.

This hotel is not comfortable, not maintaned, or transparent.

title: Super hôtel
text:
Très bel hôtel, idéalement situé dans le sur de Manathan.
Proximité direct avec plusieurs lignes de métro, 5mn du pont de Brooklyn, 5 mn du mémorial du 11 septembre et de la One World Trade Center.
Quartier calme.
L’hôtel est très bien décoré, le bar était agréable et permettait de passer un bon moment en fin de journée.
La chambre était parfaite et très propre. 
Je recommande fortement cet hôtel !

title: The friendliest front desk in the city
text: From the moment we arrived, the team at the Moxy made our whole family feel welcome. Everyone at the front desk was so nice. We loved the games and the mood in the hotel, and the rooms were good and functional, we got upgraded to a room with a view! But the best was Jose, who took care of us throughout our trip, from helping with our bags and parking and giving us tips for the city. We look forward to coming back next time!

title: Okay stay
text: Rooms we’re okay. Not your typical room set up for business travelers. You can smell weed everywhere. They charge a daily destination fee that you have to use everyday at their bar. Otherwise, you will lose it.

title: Never again
text:
I spent two nights here on business but would never stay again. Upon arrival, there was no one available to check me in, so I was asked to go upstairs and wait in the bar with my suitcase. It was after 9 pm on Sunday night and the bar was effectively a nightclub with DJ music. Once I was finally checked in, I called down about getting food. (I had traveled all day and was hungry.) The staff indicated I could order something online, but while I was in the midst of ordering, service shut down because it was 10 pm. The staff had not advised me that service would stop in a couple of minutes when I called.

The room was also extremely small - to work on the computer, I had to sit on the bed. There was no coffee available in the room. This is not an appropriate hotel for a business traveler. It appears to be designed for 20-somethings that want to party instead. If that is you, maybe you will like it.

title: Super whimsical hotel
text: Nneka was so welcoming from the moment I walked in, (hopefully I spelled her name right) she was friendly and took good care of me with getting me checked into my room which is exactly what I needed after a long day of international travel. She was very nice and seamless:) Thank You!

title: Unexpectedly wonderful gem.
text:
I have nothing but nice things to say about this hotel. We ended up here for a couple of nights, last minute, after being stranded by cancelled flights. When we first arrived, my kids were thrilled (“this is the best hotel lobby, ever!”), but I was a bit worried we (adults) were too old and uncool for the environment and that the kids would be viewed as an annoyance. I needn’t have worried. Everyone, from the front desk staff to the bar staff to the other guests, was lovely.  

The rooms (at least ours) was small but not unexpectedly so for NYC, and designed thoughtfully. The shower was fantastic. Food in the lobby was pretty good and the drinks were great. 

There is also great food in the area, if you know where to look and the Metro is mere steps away. 

I would 100% stay here again, with or without kids.

title: One hour for a toothbrush and failed at refunds
text:
Honestly the hotel is nice and overall okay. The reason why I am giving two stars is because they failed at providing me a promised refund. When I checked in I was told that the $25 destination fee is not refundable but whatever my breakfast fee is will be credited towards the $25. So I eat breakfast there. I never get the credit back. I called them a week after the stay and was informed I would be receiving an updated email with the correction within 15 minutes. This never happens and this was also a week ago. 

The other thing that happened was after I had checked into my room I called for a toothbrush. I was told it would be sent up right away. About an hour later I called back down to ask for the status. This time another person picked up and informed me I would need to come down to pick it up myself. I politely explained that is not a problem but would have been nice if someone told me that an hour ago so I wouldn’t be waiting for it and it’s now past midnight. When I said that the lady on the phone then stated she just came on shift- will ask about what was previously promised and then agreed to send someone up with a toothbrush.

I hope they can use this review to work on improving their processes so future clients have a better experience with them.

title: Meh
text: The hotel looks beautiful, but they clearly picked style over function. The rooms are small and barely have any furniture besides a bed, two flimsy fold out stools, and a ridiculous hanging chair/swing. No closet, no table, no dresser. Two people with any amount of luggage would not fit in the room. The water pressure is terrible and the elevators are slow. There is a $25 destination fee per day. You are credited $25 for food/drinks purchased ‘on site’- as there is only a bar at the hotel, no restaurant, I ordered from the (very limited) room service menu. I was later informed that the credit was only for purchases at the bar, but since that was not made clear to me up front, they did offer to refund me. I appreciate that the staff was helpful and friendly, but they are unfortunately working at a very poorly designed hotel.

title: Overnight construction noise
text: There's a construction project next to it, which makes huge noises overnight. Stay FAR FAR away if you want to sleep. The minimal design philosophy is stylish. Location is convenient -- subway stations within 5 minutes walking distance

title: Fantastic
text: I was pleasantly surprised! This was one of the best hotel experiences ever. It was clean and comfortable and the staff made our stay fantastic. We had a beautiful room with a view that was incredible….our room had a view of the Brooklyn Bridge.. so all all, we recommend this hotel.

title: Every Guest's Nightmare
text:
After 2,000,000 miles and 40 countries, I can honestly say that this is the WORST excuse for a hotel that I have experienced in decades.  

The room is barely big enough for the bed. There is neither a desk nor seating, and no place in the 9 x 10 room to put them. 

Calls to the GM were not returned, and they added FEES on top of the room rate for "services" neither requested nor wanted  -- and not used.

title: An average stay
text: We chose the hotel for its fantastic location and the fact Moxy hotels are fairly hip, cool and modern.  Location was absolutely amazing and there is so much in the vicinity to do or eat/drink etc we really loved it.  The small, narrow reception was adequate enough -  we were checked in by a lady who said we were 20 mins early, so the room she could give us was a twinned room available immediately.  I jokingly said if it was an upgrade we’d take it!  That didn’t go down well for some reason and then all of a sudden our original room was ready.  Weird.  The room was very bijou, and the do clever things like store the ironing board under your bed (it just requires someone to tell you that rather than going on a hunt for it).  The room was super cool and did not disappoint in that way, the view was ok but we were not on a high floor.  Heavenly soft bed, fantastic bathroom and shower and we loved the shower gel/shampoo fragrance they use.  The main bar area by morning is all very serious, with lots of serious people with Apple laptops and iced lattes but by night it is a very lively place indeed with a fun vibe which we liked.  Upon check out, we found out we were supposed to use tokens given to us on check in……great….so we scurried upstairs to try and use them on the restricted items specified.  Check out was marred by the issues which should not have occurred upon check in but all in all it is a nice hotel to stay in.

title: Utterly overpriced, impersonal, and making charges on goods that you did not consume
text: Utterly overpriced hotel, impersonal, ugly and with bad service. they charge you things that you did not consume, making use of your credti card and send the invoice after you have checked out without any chances to contact them to correct the error (I have been held waiting on the phone for 20 minutes without results).

title: Mon séjour au Moxy.
text: J'ai adoré ma chambre pour le design et la vue. Mais il manquait de l'espace pour le rangement. Très propre et la gestion de l'éclairage est excellent. Le reste de l'hôtel est plutôt moyen. Le personnel semblait plutôt blasé parfois. Belle vue du lobby au troisième et belle ambiance.

title: Moxy Hotel Downtown - NYC
text:
Pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Great use made of space in the room which was small (although allegedly upgraded to a bigger room size). GREAT check-in experience so a huge thank you and shout out to both Winnie and Brittney (sorry if I misspelled the names). 

Hotel gives guests a $25 drink/food credit to be used in-house so we had a couple of cocktails at the hotel's "Recreation Bar" (apparently owned separately from the hotel itself) which was also a great experience. Bartender Maria is a star! And Christian as well.  Very sweet, welcoming and attentive. We also had breakfast bowls there in the morning which I definitely would recommend. 

This hotel is steps aways from the subways, the Occulus, the World Trade Ctr, the Seaport and many restaurants. Hit Joe's Pizza down the street for a great slice.

We'll be back! 100%.

title: Great hotel
text: Brilliant place to stay. So welcoming and great communal spaces to hang out too. Location was safe and easy to get to the subway. Pizza place nearby was amazing. I’d recommend this place - the rooms are comfy and a decent size and the bathroom was lovely too.

title: Great Staff, Location, & Amenities!
text: My husband booked Moxy Downtown for our New York trip and Moxy did not disappoint! The front desk team was so accommodating and attentive; they made our stay feel VIP! not to mention the amenities! Indoor Basketball court, laid back bar with tasty bites was a really nice touch. Most importantly , we were celebrating our anniversary , so the staff so graciously decorated our bed with rose petals before our arrival and gave us drink tokens to enjoy for our stay. I wasn't expecting a hotel in nyc to offer so much at a pretty reasonable rate. above and beyond! I'll def be booking Moxy again!

title: Great staff, clean and fun hotel
text: Moved to the Moxy after a terrible stay at La Quinta by Central Park. The staff here were helpful, professional and friendly. The hotel is clean and modern. The room was also warm (not at the previous one), and had everything you needed for a short stay. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Great Stay for Young Family bc of Basketball Court!
text: Moxy Downtown is a great location. Bagels, pizza, shopping, and the subway are all literally steps from the front door. We had two young children and they loved the basketball court!! What a welcome reprieve in winter! There were other games in the room too, and skeeball in the lounge, but the best part was that the staff all made us feel like we were at home. I can't recommend this place enough. I look forward to returning. Many thanks to the entire team who made us feel so welcome!

title: Fun and friendly! Great location!
text:
My sister and I took a quick trip to NYC this weekend, and we stayed at the Moxy Downtown. This hotel is right in the heart of Lower Manhattan, with views of One World Trade Center a block away.  The Fulton Street subway station is within 2 blocks, and Joe's Pizza is a late-night must!

Starting with our check-in, throughout our stay, and at check-out,  all of the staff were very friendly and helpful. Winnie at the front desk was awesome! The bar on the 3rd floor has a fun atmosphere and great music. We will definitely be back someday!

title: Love moxy
text:
Love the moxy!! The staff is fabulous - they make Moxy the moxy! The location is great, safe and plenty in walking distance. The lobby area with bar , games and basketball court is very unique. 
The rooms are small but it is NYC! All nyc rooms are small. Some of the other negative reviews make no sense. Moxy is a unique hotel brand , if you want four seasons vibes and service then pay to stay there. Moxy is definitely different but it’s crisp , clean & have amazing people working who are truly hospitality gems- that’s all that matters to me and my experience! Don’t sleep on Moxy Downtown.

title: AVOID !!
text: Avoid this hotel if you are not a backpacker/tourist. Hotel is a disaster for the business traveler. No desk in the room. Ridiculous lobby area -starts playing loud lounge music from 6.30 AM onwards.

title: A youth hostel desguised as a hotel with Marriott prices.
text:
This is a youth hostel desguised as a hotel with Marriott prices.
It is unbievable how can Marriott ofer such low quality: staff totally unprepared and amateur, from frontdesk to management. Hotel full of kids drinking (and they help and support the idea of a permanent party).
We ended In the street one night because the fire alarm went on: someone must have been smoking In the room; reading more reviews we’ve discovered is a common thing to happen.
Another day, only one of the three elevators was working In a 29 floor building.
Problems with our reservation happened 3 days In a row with the same argument for it: there was a mishunderstanding…

Moxy NYC downtown is clearly a tourist trap. Marriott should be ashamed of this low quality and service under their brand. Avoid.

title: Not worth it, avoid
text:
Where to start….so many issues…..
Rooms are really small…. Very small…
Ac noisy …..come on we are in 2020 and you have noisy AC in rooms
No water pressure or hot water
No front desk to check in or to talk to someone
Not worth the price we pay
No parking

title: Thank You!
text: Special thanks Alysse, Steven & Mgr Brittany - reservations screwed up our rate but the hotel honored it. Everyone we encountered  was welcoming and gracious. Standard NYC room - decor is quite different but enjoyed it. Kids enjoyed the basketball court and games in restaurant. Close proximity to great places to eat and easy access to train. Would stay again.

title: Hotel thinks they can do what they want, so don’t expect Marriott standards here.
text:
Overall, just can’t recommend this hotel, especially at the prices they charge. Hotel basically told me they don’t participate in mobile check in. Guess what, Marriott mandated all hotels be ready to accept mobile check in by June 2021. They’re 18+ months behind that, and refused to honor it.

They also didn’t offer the relevant Platinum / Titanium benefit choices. After pressing it, they did offer me the benefit guarantee and said they would align on offering that in the future, so I guess that will remain to be seen.

Just not impressed at all. And ESPECIALLY at the prices they want. Stay at the Marriott Downtown if you want a good Marriott brand hotel in the area.

title: Overpriced and under delivering
text: I have stayed in many hotels in New York over the years and I’m aware that some rooms can be small. This has to be the hotel with the smallest room I’ve ever stayed in. It is so tiny you cannot unpack. To work you have to sit on the end of the bed. The couple of staff I spoke to have been rude and I think the element for me that takes the biscuit for $450 hotel room a night to have No Coffee in the room and have to go to the bar to pay for a coffee is ridiculous. This is the first and last time I will ever stay here.

title: LOVED MY STAY
text: As a mom traveling solo for work this was the perfect mix of a fun and upbeat environment but also felt restful. The rooms were adorable, a great size, and the bar/food was good too. Very friendly staff and a great lobby for getting work done!

title: Beware
text: King bed is the size of a queen.  They will insist it is a king though.  Even if you requested a roll away and a lower floor in advance, they may provide you with neither.  Now three of us will be enjoying a queen bed.  One star.

title: Solid option for downtown NY
text:
Interesting  little hotel with good location and vibrant evening events. Rooms are small but have some interesting design features. Breakfast was good and I was more than happy with bar’s craft beer selection. 
The only issue was communication - it was hard to reach someone at the reception via phone or app. Also, would be great to see staff in some uniforms instead in some (very) relaxed home clothes.

title: High price but low quality hotel with no extras provided.
text:
I recently stayed at the Moxy Hotel for 3 nights. 

I arrived having flown a transatlantic flight to phone down to reception to be told that they don’t offer room service at all, most disappointing for a 4 star hotel. There was no tea / coffee making facilities in the room, no turn down and room cleaning was every other day. 

From when I checked in on the Monday afternoon and when I returned to my room on the Wednesday afternoon my room still hadn’t been cleaned. I had to phone down to reception to get it finally cleaned. A pizza box that I put outside my hotel door remained there for over 24 hours and was never cleared, even after housekeeping had been to clean my room. 

For a hotel that charges $480 a night they offer a terrible service but know how to charge. I shared this feedback with front desk on my departure and was assured it would be given to the manager but so far I have heard nothing back. Most disappointing stay at the Moxy and wouldn’t recommend.

title: no value for money
text: the showers have no pressure whatsoever, worse than in a camping... no way to control the temperature of the water... the light switches did not work properly. Was staying in room 2304 but I do not see a reason why these problems should be limited to that room only. Truly no value for money

title: Amanda at the front desk is really a superstar
text: I had an awesome trip to New York during Climate Week and had an unfortunate flight schedule. Amanda made sure I was taken care of during my stay. I'm so thankful. Comfy bed, sheets, blackout curtains, etc. Thanks again Amanda.

title: Would have been a better stay had I been able to take a shower....
text: Hey Moxy Downtown!  Many of your guests, myself included, were unable to shower on the morning of Tuesday September 20th due to lack of water in the hotel.  While I understand sometimes these things happen and they are beyond your control, what is in your control is the manner in which your staff responds to inquiries about why there was no water.    Being rudely handed a bottle of water and wash cloth (after a morning run and 45 minutes before a big business meeting) was not a great way to start the day.  Moreover, the promised "consideration" of a commensurate adjustment to my bill did not happen either.  Is there an appropriate person and contact details with whom I can discuss this experience?

title: Great experience fashion week
text: Highly recommended.  Very nice spot in a good location. Brittney is so helpful snd friendly.  We stayed during busy fashion week time but this is a well run spot that doesn’t skip a beat. Cool lobby area with bar and games too

title: Best hotel + team in NYC
text: I had the pleasure of staying here this past weekend for a work trip and I was completely blown away by the level of service + attention to detail. The front desk, bar and bell hop went above and beyond to make sure my team and I had everything we needed for our work event. No ask was too big or too small. A huge thank you to Ralph, Chelsea and Miguel for making this my best work trip to NYC to date. I will definitely be back to this location.

title: Definitely not for a long stay
text: I stayed here with my daughter in the beginning of august for 9 days. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable, but it was extremely tiny. We had a two queen room with a swing, there was no desk and no dresser. The room looked out to other rooms so I stopped opening the blinds. The bathroom is a decent size but the actual room is so small you have to be extremely careful walking to the beds so you don’t get hurt. There is no closet and no where to put your luggage. There are no ice machines so that has to be requested from the front desk. I will say, they brought things up fairly quickly when I asked. You have to take two separate elevators to get to the guest rooms. My biggest complaint is that the hotel puts an extremely large hold on your credit card on file daily. We were staying there on points and by then end of the trip had a ridiculous $22,000 hold on our credit card which took a while to straighten out. We heard several people complaining about the same issue. We never had anything like that happen at any other Marriott before. Location wise this was convenient for where we needed to be, however I would never stay here again, I would rather walk further. It might be okay for a very short stay with minimal luggage, but watch your charges daily!

title: A very pleasant stay with a terrific staff.
text: I lived in Manhattan almost all of my adult life -14 years, but wasn't familiar with the Moxy hotels outside of knowing the name.  Now living in San Diego, we had a business meeting in FiDi.  Check-in was smooth and the front desk was terrific.  Winnie, in particular.  I ended up extending my stay and, unlike most hotels, they told me to book online for best price and they would make sure I wouldn't have to change rooms -which can be tedious.  Food was solid and the bar was quite nice.  The staff were remarkable: a lot of smiles and nice conversation.  Very cool!

title: Overall good
text: Rooms are small but they have a great bar and great views the front desk and staff were wonderful they really did help me feel like I was at home even when I was so many miles away. I wish I could remember the young lady’s name at the front but she was just great.

title: Moxy hotel
text: Great room with views! Fatima at front desk was super helpful! Good location and newly built. Room sizes are a bit small so not great for families. However would recommend for business. I have stayed here multiple times and quality and service is consistent

title: Service
text: Alysse is one of the best staff at this property! Accommodated our requests and had everything available. Drink tokens are given at the hotel as well. Beds are comfortable and property features a unique vibe.

title: Very “Meh”, Avoid This Non-Foxy Moxy
text: This hotel two star hotel pretending to be a four star. But the music, neon lights and artsy decorations don’t hide the fact this hotels comes up short in almost all areas.  The rooms are oppressively small and lack most of the basics like a fridge or a desk. The Wi-Fi barely works. The shower runs at half pressure and the staff seem more interested in TikTok than helping guests. Do yourself a favor and skip this non-foxy moxy.

title: Vacanza
text:
Classificato come quattro stelle 😐 non le merita giudicando la mia camera non molto pulita il letto a 20 cm dalla finestra senza un ripiano che servisse da appoggio per la notte per acqua o altro, e uno spazio occupato da una sedia appesa molto ingombrante con residui sul cuscino di capelli del precedente ospite ,nel bagno il sapone con dosatore non funzionava
In compenso al desktop il personale è stato gentile anche al bar anche esso non molto pulito.

title: A gem in downtown NYC
text: We arrived at the hotel from Montreal very tired in the evening, however check in was smooth staff was very welcoming and nice! Hotel was very clean from the entrance, to the elevators all the way to the room! A gorgeous gorgeous bar/lounge is located on the third floor. The views are absolutely breathtaking! The rooms are spacious, very clean and very nicely decorated! I love how modern it looks. Housekeeping was friendly and always ready to help just like the front desk staff. Thank you all for the most amazing stay! Book now! You won’t regret it 10/10!!

title: Excellent hotel
text:
Stayed for the night with my service bulldog for a mini staycation and couldn’t have been more pleased … the room is small but SO SO well designed… comfortable bed, cool hanging chair, comfy bed and SUPER soundproof.  The lobby is H U G E and fun with tons of space to tuck yourself in and read or work … nice vibe and really lovely staff … will definitely be coming back for a stay 

*if from out of town the location is perfect … walking distance to all downtown attractions and tucked on a low traffic block a stones throw from all major subway lines

title: Horrible Hotel
text: Very small rooms. Not even a chair available. Had to take a work call sitting on a swing. No moisturizer in the bathrooms and water pressure is very weak. Service is non existent called the front desk SO many times from the room and the call was never answered. There are NO closets or drawers in the room with only three hangers available to hang clothes on the wall. Tried to ask for more hangers but as stated there was no answer.  Have stayed in Marriott hotels for years and this is not a Marriott experience.

title: Ueseless, cheap and terrible
text:
Useless.

The location is good.
The rooms and the service are awful.

Rooms: small as everywhere; but to the point that there is no wardrobe - one is supposed to hang clothes on free hangers on a wall which makes a room look incredibly messy.
There also is no desk, and there are no chairs. There is instead a bulky and instagrammable but entirely useless hanging chair that occupies the only useful space.
Also no fridge/minibar/coffee machine or hot water kettle. Absolutely nothing.

Sheets are not ironed. The sheet cover was dirty. There also is no duvet in case one is cold (and where would they store it, there is no wardrobe!!).
Same as the bathroom floor: filthy.
Moreover, there is no body lotion, no toiletries other than soap, shampoo and conditioner.

Service - when I arrived to check in I didn’t see a single smile from the receptionist, she was cold to the point of almost being rude.

title: Tolles Lokal mit vielen Sightseeing-Anbindungen in unmittelbarer Umgebung
text:
Modernes Hotel in toller Lage in NY - sprichwörtlich muss man nur 1x umfallen und man ist beim ONE, 9/11 Memorial und Museum und Oculus, wo man einen Schlechtwettertag zum Shoppen verbringen kann. Auch die Brooklyn Bridge ist sehr nahe. In unmittelbarer Umgebung sind viele nette Lokale, mit der um die Ecke gelegene U-Bahnstation ist man sofort in Midtown,...
Die Zimmer sind zwar klein - entsprechen aber absolut New Yorker Standard. Das Bad ist für New Yorker Verhältnisse relativ geräumig. Es war alles sehr sauber - Zimmerreinigung / Tausch Handtücher wurde auf Anfrage gemacht. Das Hotel lädt in der Lounge / an der Bar zum Verweilen ein.

title: Low Key Cool, great location
text: 3rd Moxy that I've stayed in in NYC.  I'd say fit the same vibe as the others.  Small, modern, comfortable rooms. Bed and linens were super comfortable, great automatic shade button and automatic light buttons.  Room seemed very clean, I did find a toenail on the floor (not mine) but tried to pretend I didn't see it!  I liked that the sink was in the bathroom.  The other Moxys I've stayed in, it was in the main part of the room. I ended up working from the hotel before heading home and because the room was small, would have loved to work in the wide open, restaurant like lobby, but the music was super loud even in the morning.  Otherwise, a nice stay in a very convenient area.

title: A good stay
text: For those who don’t know, Moxy is the hip, youth oriented Marriott property brand.  Expect furnishings to align with that aesthetic.  The hotel entrance is one a small side street but not hard to find.  Don’t expect bellman or cans outside the door.  This is a no frills place.  We enjoyed the decor and the bball court and skeball game in the lobby are a favorite for our kids ages 11 and 7.  The hotel is very close and easily walkable to all Sept 11th activities like the memorial and museum.  There are plenty of restaurants around for easy breakfasts and quick dinners.  I was surprised we weren’t upgraded as hotel didn’t seem to be at full capacity.  We were on 7th floor facing another building with no view whatsoever. The hotel includes two bottles of water in the room which was nice.  There is no coffee maker.  You can pay $ for coffee in the lobby or grab one outside the hotel.  The on-site shop is tiny with few snacks and nothing else.  As expected, most patrons were very young.  Room very tiny.  Again as expected.  Nicely furnished though.  I wouldn’t have wanted to stay more than two nights in the space with two children though.  Cramped quarters led to many toe stubbings on furniture!  There are now cabinets for clothing or closet.  A few hangers on the wall.  Beds were comfortable.  A good stay for how long we were there and what we wanted to do in the area.

title: It’s kind 3 star Hotel !
text:
We came yesterday from Uptown to Dowtown to discover this area. 
I’m a hotel advisor and my job is checking hotels. 
We checked in on time and I booked a  special city view queen room. 
We arrived in our room 1910. There was no curtain in the room and all the buttons were not working. They checked it for us and tried to reset it but still nothing worked. Then we went to reception and changed our room. 
The Second room we got is literally looking to a wall. The second rooms no: 1902 and we didn’t like it ! 
The staff left their cleaning outfits in the bathroom, and the hand soap dispensers are not working and to top it all of the towel were torn. Not small big full torn !
We asked for another room and was told hotel is full,  ask tomorrow and maybe we can do something. 
Anyway there is nothing good to write in this hotel and building and this is literally not Marriott hotel and not Moxy standards. I am very upset I ever stepped foot in this hotel. Avoid at all coast, you will regret coming here :((

title: Wonderful Stay
text:
My husband and I had a great time at the Moxy! Every staff member we had contact with were courteous and helpful. We complained about the noise from the ground and they promptly moved us from the 14th floor to the 27th floor
With an amazing view. Definitely returning to this hotel on our next visit. I highly recommend it!

title: Horrible
text: ONLY STAY HERE IF IT IS YOUR LAST RESORT. I honestly have no earthly idea whatsoever as to why this racket is rated above one star. The staff hides in the back from their responsibilities, the “hotel” doesn’t provide bars of soap, the showers have no temperature gauge (it’s either scalding hot with normal pressure or ice cold with little to no pressure), rooms sizes are falsified, the showers don’t work when it freezes outside, the basketball court is unavailable due to made up reasons, the “arcade” is a joke, pretend “engineers” are employed, and the general manager was nowhere to be found. No answers if something goes awry, they just hand you the "GM's" card and says it their fault, when they just hide in the back with 15 Plus guests looking for a resolution of their situation. Location is the only appeal to this place, oh yeah, almost forgot, have to go up 3 floors to the lobby. Just false pretenses all over the website. Do yourself a favor and stay at an ACTUAL Marriott.

title: Wonderful Stay!
text:
Rafael the bellman was the first person to greet us. He was extremely helpful, kind, professional and hospitable. He helped us with our excessive luggage, recommended restaurants and went above and beyond through our stay! Thank you Rafael! People like YOU makes a vacation wonderful!

The Hotel itself was clean, hip, trendy and awesome location.  Everyone was pleasant. Upgraded us to a beautiful view of the Brooklyn bridge. 

Rachel and Brian

title: Best hotel for your money downtown.
text: Love this place! Great rates. Great location could not be more prime location downtown. I keep coming back. Highly recommended. The service and hospitality is A++ great cocktails at the bar. One of the best club / restaurants in the same building. Rooms are perfectly equipped. Slept like a dream - super comfy beds. I’ll be back very soon

title: Nice hotel
text: Good location nice rooms and people were great. Very quiet on Saturday night with no bar service. The bed was comfortable. Skee ball in lobby bar was fun as was the whole decor but I guess with covid no one was there to justify a dj playing or drinks being served.

title: Best place to stay in NYC
text: Had an extremely easy check in.   Rooms were what we’d expect for NYC downtown.    From the time of arrival downstairs to the time we left.  Service was incredible!  Huge thanks to everyone at the Moxy downtown that made it a great stay

title: Ripped Off!
text:
The Moxy brand seems to be an attempt my Marriott to remain relevant in a changing world and they have failed! Clearly someone put a fancy marketing person in charge at some point. 

We spent a significant amount of points to stay here for 8 nights and we were utterly disappointed.

The room is tiny. No room to swing a cat let alone place any personal items. The room is appropriate for a short stay but not 8 nights. 

The hotel amenities don’t exist. From the morning coffee always being out to breakfast consisting of some sliced fruit! 

The bar and restaurant was closed and looked like it had been for a while. 

The self service snack and drink area looked like it had not been restocked in months! 

We are three nights in and not once has our room been serviced. 

For the hotel to be considered in the same category as a full serviced Marriott is a joke.

title: Birthday month
text: Omg...I really loved my stay at the Moxy Hotel....friendly ..Great service...staff was like family...roos was very clean...I fell in love with my shower and my gift basket was amazing...This will be my private get away...Thank you Moxy family for making my birthday special..... Rosantat Mckinnon

title: Fungy Hotel in the Big Apple
text:
We stayed at Moxy NYC Downtown for 7 nights in July 2019. It was relatively new back then. The room was very small and not functional well for us. During the first night we had problem with loud noise from the AC, they finally gave in and switched us after midnight.

Room - Tiny and fungy. Not functional well for us.
Service - Terrible reception they were indifferent but great and friendly doorman
Facility - Nice gym
Food - Breakfast was ok 

*Stay in July 2019*

title: NYC at Moxy, a wonderful experience!
text: From the moment we walked in the door we were greeted and treated like one of the gang, the staff was very approachable which made the stay in a large unfamiliar city much more comfortable. Megan D. provided top notch service and went above and beyond our expectations! The Moxy definitely has a fun and playful vibe, I loved this combined with the modern and distinct decor all the while being impeccably clean.

title: Jose
text:
I loved drinking at the bar with Brian C. The man is excellent vibes. We came for one drink and stayed for five because we were giving out. Highly recommend! Will be coming back soon

P.s. Brian reminds me of Vinny Chase

title: A true steal for downtown NYC
text: I’m originally from Manhattan and had to go back recently for a weekend. As a native New Yorker, I can honestly say The Moxy’s a true steal for its location and price. It’s near everything downtown (including One World Trade and other attractions) and is only a short subway ride away from the rest of what New York City has to offer. I highly recommend it!

title: Wow NYC
text: Excellent hotel, fab location close to Ground Zero, modern, nice clean rooms, lovely bar meeting area, good security access to lifts. Friendly helpful staff. No night noise. Subway just round the corner. Highly recomnended

title: Go to hotel
text: My frequent stays at the Moxy only improve as I continue to return to this location. I am always provided excellent customer service, recommendations, and amenities within the room that make the experience pleasant. Any issues are always dealt with immediately and always professional. One of the many employees there Rachel and another employee there named Rich are very polite every visit and I always look forward to seeing them at the Moxy I look forward to returning soon.

title: Trendy bar with games
text: Great bar area with games, good dj and solid food. The space is large and comfortable. They have solid happy hours deals. Brian C mixes one of the best spicy margaritas around. Friendly staff.  A trendy gem in FIDI.

title: It was ehhh
text: The service was kind, helpful and resourceful.  The room had a smoke smell and the room did not feel clean.  Would not go back to this hotel.  The front desk people helped with parking, taxi and questions we had.  Richard was extra helpful!!

title: Great location, great customer service!
text: I came to New York for a longer than normal stay. I needed a great location close to the office but also close to the action. The Moxy Downtown was perfect for both. The rooms are cool and funky and very minimal, totally my style. When I first arrived on a Thursday night there was a Dj spinning music at the bar, I got to use my free drink coin and it was on. Half way through my stay, I started to feel like I needed a little more room, I had done a lot of shopping and started to run out of room. I mentioned this to the concierge Rachel, and she helped me out. She got me into something just a little bit bigger and it made a world of difference. Thank you Rachel + Moxy NYC for making my stay magical. :)

title: Functional no frills hotel near financial district.
text:
Very functional hotel near the financial district of Manhattan. Easy walk to Broadway, The Brooklyn Bridge and the Fulton Street subway station. Close to local restaurants and stores. We stayed in room 1101 - King bed with a city view.
The Moxy has a cool bar and relaxation area which is always hopping in the evenings! However, the Moxy is one of those chic, hip, no frills hotels so do not expect a refrigerator in your room or a safe or an iron. The rooms also have an interesting window hatch between the bedroom and the shower with a sliding photo that can be used to block the view...but control of the sliding photo is on the bedroom side!
(Maybe a problem if you are traveling with kids 😳😂) 
Also, and I’m sure this is the hotels fault, but every time the air came on, you would get a faint smell of weed. 😬 The only other complain would be that the sheets felt like they were made of parchment paper and not very comfortable.

title: Not for us
text:
We recently stayed at the Moxy whilst on a short visit to NYC. The hotel is located in a good location and it takes less than a minute to get onto the subway. It’s also very close to Wall Street, China Town, Brooklyn Bridge and the World Trade Centre. The property was easy to find and it has a good selection of nearby stores and restaurants. 

The hotel staff were mostly very good. The luggage porter was excellent and was definitely the most helpful and friendly member of the team. The hotel reception is rather small, but I guess it does the job. The colleague that checked us in was very pleasant and helpful. However, we did drop by the reception on one occasion and the woman behind the desk was very unhelpful, blunt and rather rude.

The decor and theme of the property was fitting and rather well done. However it’s most definitely a property for the younger crowd and millennials. 

The room was really rather small (but this is NYC) and it had a good view. However it did lack some of the amenities that we would have wanted at our fingertips e.g. coffee facilities, but that was most likely poor planning on our behalf. 

In the room the fan was either on full or auto which is rather annoying, it would be nice to be able to select a continuous low fan. The bed was comfortable however the duvet is incredibly thin, it was much more of a blanket rather than that of a duvet. We did sleep well and on the whole we found the room quiet in a busy city. 

You have to take two elevators to get between ground level and your room which is rather annoying and a feature of properties that we tend to dislike. It may sound trivial, but having to wait for two elevators in a busy hotel when all you need to do is quickly get to or from your room is pretty annoying. 

We wouldn’t stay here again but I can appreciate that it’s (Moxy) just isn’t a brand of Marriott for us. Between me and my partner we stay at Marriott hotels around 300 days per year. So we’re very loyal to the brand however this just isn’t for us. The hotel felt much more like a youth hostel than a hotel and that’s not what we wanted.

title: 2/22/2020 Stay
text: This was my first stay at Moxy and me and my girlfriend loved our stay! The recreation, basketball court, bar are truly amazing! Makes you not even want to even leave to go anywhere else for drinks. They even had a DJ! The room was comfy and truly perfect for our one night stay! I went ahead and booked my next stay for my birthday next month. Thanks so much to the staff at Moxy for an amazing experience!

title: Moxy Hotel Brand is Great for Young Business Travellers
text: First experience at Moxy.  Crowd is very Gen Z/Millennial.  Tough to get space for relaxation at the end of the workday in Rec area.  Front desk staff went over and above after an initial mistake.  Head and body shampoo isn't a good choice for female travelers. AC/Heating system in room is loud.....

title: Bellman was amazing
text: The Moxy was amazing experience. but the best part of our stay was the bond we formed with the bellman Richard. he greeted us with a giant smile and a warm hello. on our last night he took us up to the top floor to get a amazing look at the Manhattan Bridge. Richard took our experience from good to great. we (a family of 4) got 2 rooms with 2 queen beds in each. that was a good move because the rooms were pretty small. overall a great trip. (Richard deserves a raise for all the good work he’s doing

title: Very nice stay
text: Just spent three nights at this hotel on a family vacation and really enjoyed staying here. The room was comfortable.  I especially liked the shower. When we arrived on Saturday, we were told our room wasn’t ready which was odd considering the time. The front desk person gave us chips for free drinks in the very nice 3rd floor lounge. We eventually got into our room around 7 p.m.  Other than that glitch, all else was fine.  The hotel is in a good location — very near the 9/11 memorial— with easy access to the subway.

title: Millennial Hell.
text:
I should have known better than to stay at a Hotel, whose recorded message starts out with Hey .. what’s up! Seriously.. rude staff. No manners. The room itself , no issues .. however everyone talks down to everyone. Very annoying. The free drink tokens are a joke and cannot be used lol .. why give them out? This hotel may work for some . Not me .
Pretentious crap.

title: Fun and friendly hotel
text: 5 couples that we know all stayed here on a Saturday night.  We had a great time.  Everyone was very friendly and bar was hopping later on in the night .  Rooms are pretty roomy for a Manhattan hotel.  Not a ton to do in that area but if you want to stay downtown this is a great place to stay.

title: Great
text: From the Check in and Check out the experience was great i was able to get lucky to find a parking outside in the front. The beautiful lady Destiny is a genius she help me pull up my employee discount when i was struggling to do so lol. Plus the Bellman i forget his name was great as well. Definitely will be back in the future.

title: Indicado para jovens e sem bagagens.
text:
Moxy Hotel em Manhattan

O Cultura Alternativa esteve no @moxyhotels em Nova York com boa localização no centro próximo a estação de metrô, em estilo moderno e descolado.

Indicado para jovens e sem bagagens.

title: Great staff!
text: My partner and I stayed here recently and loved it. The hotel was super accommodating and the room we had was great. We only had one small problem but we were quickly helped by a pleasant young woman named Celine. Thanks so much for the stay!

title: Good location .... typical Moxy style hotel
text: Quite close to the WallStreet and Ground Zero this hotel represents the prototype of the Mariott brand Moxy. Small rooms, clean, practical. Good mood in the lobby on 3rd floor. Personnel was mostly friendly. Some not. Unusual for the brand. Some of them seemed to work too long hour, e g at reception. Overall a good reco, not cheap though. Upper floors quiet which is key in that city to get some sleep at least.

title: Work Offsite
text: We had our work offsite at the Moxy NYC Downtown. The staff was wonderful, rooms were great, bar was excellent (plus they have a skee-ball alley and shuffleboard table) and the meeting space was fun and functional! Highly recommend ...

title: Off site corporate event
text: We used their mixed space for a corporate event of 35 people.  Open air space. Stadium style chair set up with AV set up.  Excellent coffee, snacks and lunch. Separate set up for our photographer to do headshots.  Event ran perfectly and people were always around to help make sure we had everything we needed.  We definitely use the hotel again.

title: Amazing Staff
text: I really loved my stay when I stayed with my boyfriend. The front desk staff were so kind and caring. Rachel and another young lady checked us in and they were phenomenal!! It was my boyfriend's birthday and they did a full blown room decor. Fabulous. Will definitely be coming back!!

title: Birthday weekend
text: This is actually my 3rd time visiting this hotel and i absolutely love it!! I came for a date night with my husband, my daughters birthday & for my birthday I love the bar/ lounge area great vibes, games & food!!.the bartenders are amazing! Rachel, Celine, matt, Raulph & rich gave us the most warm welcome we felt very comfortable and right at home!! I will def come back!!

title: Great downtown spot, everything you need.
text: First up thanks to Loren and Celine for being great this trip. The hotel is located at a great spot, close to everything you need at any time of the day including the famous Joe's Pizza and Shake Shack burgers just within minutes. Wall St is a good 10 minutes walk away, and the room was really comfortable -- we stayed during winter. The lounge was awesome as a hang-out spot to meet others too. Will be back again! Cheers from Aussie.

title: Exceeded my expectations, Celine and Matt Made my Experience 110% positive
text: I stayed here this past weekend for a business trip and needed an early check-in/late check out and Celine made that happen. Both Celine and Matt were welcoming and provided tips of places to see during my stay. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Anniversary Surprise!
text: Came for my anniversary with my significant other and everything was beautiful. Celine gave us the absolute best treatment, from a great room and view, great amenities, to an even better room layout with rose petals and a beautiful message on the mirror. Romantic and beautiful to say the least. 10/10 will come again for her service alone. Ambiance of everything and everyone else was great, such an amazing idea with the bar, game room, and indoor gym. Had an amazing time and I can’t wait to book again!!

title: Great stay, convenient location
text: Trendy hotel, lively bar area. Friendly staff, Rafael was very helpful. Stayed for a week during a business trip. My colleagues enjoyed it as will. Convenient to subway (Fulton St), 24hr CVS, late night pizza joint.

title: Bien situé
text: Hôtel très bien situé plusieurs lignes de métro desserve cet endroit les chambres ne sont pas très grande mais il est très agréable le seul petit bémol aucune armoire dans la chambre pour ranger ses affaires tout doit être accroché au mur et aucune étagère le personnel est très agréable attention avec les prestations de la laverie les taches sur les draps ne sont pas très agréable

title: Such a Great Time
text: We were at Moxy celebrating my friend’s birthday after work, and the service and music were impeccable. Briannia Walters was our waiter/bartender, and she was the absolute best. Kind, fun, awesome. Definitely try to get her for your next function. Will 100% be back.

title: Briannia made my experience
text:
Briannie literally made my experience and I would not have stayed if it wasnt for her. She was attentive and true joy to be around.

She took care of a friend who was experiencing a bad time and made it her mission to ensure they would enjoy themselves. And it worked!

title: Great hotel, excellent location
text: I've stayed at Moxy Downtown twice, I've enjoyed my stays there. Awesome location and great lobby bar on the third floor. Loren and Matt were very accommodating, I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in lower Manhattan.

title: Recreation Bar!!
text: Moxy’s rec bar is a hidden gem in lower Manhattan. It has a modern speakeasy feel but there is an energy about this place and a lot of fun to be had here. Staff like Brian makes you want to visit again

title: Love this place
text:
Me and my friends love going to the bar at Moxy, delicious food - tuna tartare and chicken with waffle my favorites
and perfect cocktails 🍹🧡 - thanks to Brian
Also, there is great atmosphere and cool crowds

title: Great Area
text: Stayed 3 nights the hotel is in a great area walking distance from the the mall, shops, restaurants, and Statue of Liberty viewing area. Front desk people were cool. The upstairs lobby was very neat and hip with games and a live DJ though I never ordered anything. Everything is very clean room/hotel is fairly new. The room and hallways were quiet and they smelled good. Cleaning service only came once on the last day. Though they did ask on the second day and I said yes please and to come back in 20 mins as I was changing and getting ready to leave the room however they never came back. Room I purchased was a king city view, though the king beds aren’t standard king beds they are smaller but that’s New York. The only thing that upset me was there was no chair swing in my room but it the pics of the room I booked on orbits it shows the chair swing in the king city view, it made me sad when I walked by rooms with the door open and I could see in and saw that they had a swinging chair. :/

title: Bon hôtel
text:
Très bel hôtel, bon emplacement.
Proche de deux grandes stations de métro et des quartiers de Chinatown, Little Italy et des finances, accessibles facilement à pieds. Proche du pont de Brooklyn.
Chambres petites mais fonctionnelles. Café et thé disponibles gratuitement le matin. Je recommande.

title: Good downtown location, good view, minimal room
text: The group we went with chose this hotel as it was in a great location for the things we needed to do, most of which were downtown.  The lobby and bar were great and the rooms, especially the view was very good.  This was a little younger, hipper than I usually do.  Rooms were very minimalist, it made an Aloft seem like luxury.  However, for as much as I use the room, it was totally sufficient.  I will say the members of our party who chose this were 20 years younger than me.  Still I totally enjoyed and I did like the communal floor with bar and other uses.  Finally, if your business is downtown, the location was very good.

title: Loved Rachel’s Hospitality!
text: Rachel over at front desk made my experience all the more sublime. The game room, drinks and night vibe w a dope DJ made everything, everythinggggg. Will definitely return to top my last visit. Thanks Rachel and team.

title: YaYa at the bar!!
text:
Her personality is infectious,she is very customer oriented,and she is the type of employee that makes me wanna come back to the Moxy for a another stay, while in  New York! The rooms are cozy and trendy, very clean. We will definitely be back for another stay soon. 

-Danny and Eddie
From Savannah GA

title: Excellent location, nice decor, took my $
text:
We generally really enjoyed our stay. My teenaged kids really liked the games and basketball hoop on the 3rd floor. Drink tickets were nice and the drinks were tasty. Excellent location within walking distance to a lot, including a great subway station. Despite what others said, we found the room (2 double beds) to be spacious enough for the 4 of us when suit cases were stored under the beds. Decor was nice and clean. 
Taking stars away for just a sheet and thin blanket on the beds (brrrrr), no turndown service one day, nobody answers the phone to help, paying for a “city view” but being on the 12th floor (hardly half way to top of building) and seeing only a few close up walls of other buildings, and most importantly, being charged ~$90 extra!!!! (White pic is my reservation, blue is the charge to my cc. We didn’t buy anything/charge anything to the room!) Can’t even get through on the phone to rectify it. I booked on the Moxy site. No paperwork given upon checkout to see individual charges. Do they put “estimated” for taxes and fees to add $$$ to bill? I don’t know. Regardless, if charges are more, they should explain and justify.  
I’d def stay again if I wasn’t nervous that they’d steal from me.

title: Great stay!
text: Beautiful hotel. The staff went out of their way to make you feel at home. Had an issue with the shades in the room and was upgraded to a bigger room with a better room. Great! Thanks to Noelle, Loren and Matt

title: Perfect downtown hotel
text:
Stayed there with my partner. From our point of view this place is perfect, it's very stylish, it offers a great view from higher floors, rooms pictures provided on various booking websites are not tweaked and you can expect the same standard, our room was spotless, the only minor drawback is the size - it could be slightly larger but for us it was not a problem. This place is a great value for your money but what makes this place unique is their staff. Celine, Lauren, Richard and above all Mat - thanks guys for making our stay such a great experience, if anyone from management reads that please take a good care of them - they are a great added value to this place.

To sum up I've stayed in quite a few hotels in NYC but this one turned to be my place. I will use it again and will recommend it to everyone.

title: Que gran experiencia, es único, es un Marriott Moxy!
text:
Great service, uncommon hotel, excellent location, perfect room size, they have a DJ performance at the bar area,i loved the hallways, the rooms, the deco, definitely a place to stay many times!! 

I hope to go back soon!

title: Best Moxy that I’ve visited yet!
text: Iv loved the Moxy Brand since it started and to say this one met the standard would be a huge understatement. We arrived very early in the morning and once we got to the hotel it was nothing but comfort! Their bar area has deep sofas and board games while you wait for your room. The views from the room were amazing (see photo). We could have slept for days in those beds and the location speaks for itself! The staff were relaxed but attentive and nothing was ever too much. I would 100% recommend to a friend!

title: Celine - front desk extraordinaire
text:
In sending my daughter off across the country to NYC unaccompanied, I thought she would have the common sense to let us (her parents) know that she arrived safely. By 10pm, she had not answered her cell phone, so I called the Moxy, and was told that there was no guest by that name. 

At a loss, I called back again to check if the reservation was made under the name of the company that hired her. Celine from the Moxy front desk came to the rescue after I gave sufficient information about myself. She said she recognized me as a concerned mother. (Missing person and NYC are not good thoughts in a situation like this....) She went above and beyond normal duty, to see past two errors in the reservation to confirm that my daughter had checked in - with the specific time - as well as her exit time with her friend as they had planned. All precise and descriptive information to give me immediate relief.
