title: Parfait
text:
Nous avons choisis cet établissement pour clôturer notre road trip américain et nous avons très bien fait 
Kevin nous a surclassé nous avons été dans une chambre au 23 étage 
Une vue de fou sur Brooklyn bridge

Truc de ouf

title: Want to rate it higher
text:
Pros: I love this location.  Quick to everywhere from Fulton Street metro stop. The room is clean and efficient. The lighting great. A drink token given at check in a nice touch to have a cool drink in the third floor lounge area.  The lounge area in general is an inviting space. 
Cons:  Is a little bar of soap too much to ask for?  I’m on board with shampoo dispensers instead of little plastic bottles—for environmental reasons (although I kind of miss them).  But not even a measly little bar of soap wrapped in paper? Marriott/Moxy has gone to far here.  Washing with shampoo/“body wash” not for everyone.  The lack of any surface area, not even for a pair of glasses or cup of coffee, in the room ( the folding table was seriously in the way when unfolded. Also while all the pegs for hanging whatever was handy, only three hangers were provided.  (There is no closet.) The hanging chair, so very trendy, was not at all comfortable— so basically other than bed, there is nowhere to comfortably sit.  There is no refrigerator— so common now, that I forgot to check beforehand.  The coffee provided in lounge is awful. Ghastly bitter mud when we tried it a few months ago— this time just weak and bitter.  The front desk people are very engaging and trying very hard, but the check in area— industrial chic— is very cramped.  And unfortunately one had the feeling that the folks working at the bar in lounge were very very very tired of honoring the nice free drink tokens given at check in.   Their begrudging attitude was such a contrast with the friendly front desk people.  While having a half basket ball court off the lounge seems so cool— it’s not really when you are trying to “chill” in the lounge and there’s the constant thump thump thump.... (and you don’t want to go to room because there is no place to sit.)

title: Destiny and Jhirette
text: I had an Amazing experience at the Moxy downtown. The Ladies that work there provided us incredible service.. To Destiny, Jhirette and the rest of the Staff i would love to say thank you for making my Stay at your Hotel a very pleasant one....

title: Nice hotel with great location for a NYC visit
text:
Great location for travelling from JFK. It's easy to get to anywhere in Manhattan or to Brooklyn with the subway from the hotel. Hotrel is walking distance from the 9/11 memorial and there is also quite many food options really close to the hotel. The closest grocery store is just 50 meter away.

The hotel had really cozy common area with a bar and some games, event a small basketball court. Room was compact and well decorated with some creative solutions to hang clothes and a foldable table. Not any extra room, but enough to get by. There is plenty of connections for electricity and some USB outlets to charge your beloved travel companions. I'm happy to visit Moxy NYC Downtown again.

title: Very unhappy.
text: I had high hopes for this hotel. I heard great things and in theory, it seemed fun with the arcade and rooftop. Unfortunately, I was immensely disappointed. When checking in, Noel was sweet. She informed me where everything was of course. I told her my boyfriend will be coming to meet me in a couple of hours. She took his name down and assured he was accounted for. A few hours later, I receive a phone call from my boyfriend saying he is having a hard time at the desk. He's asking if I have the reservation confirmation number. I hear two associates in the back laughing and giggling--what's the joke? I'm unsure. I tell him to tell them to call the room. I'm not really clear what the problem can be as I left your name with them. I hear David, the associate, say "Ohhhh why didn't you say she was in the room?" HUH? My boyfriend finally comes up and tells me that they were searching for the reservation and couldn't find it, although it clearly wasn't under his name. When he was trying to explain, they weren't listening. This is when the female associate, my boyfriend didn't get her name, began to laugh and cover her face with a sheet a paper to conceal the laughter. I called downstairs to gain clarity and David informed me "she wasn't laughing at him. she was laughing at me because I didn't know what I was doing." THAT'S what you tell guests? Listen, I've been to many hotels around NYC, but this level of unprofessionalism put the worst taste in my mouth. I was so turned off by this behavior. ALSO- before check out time, we received two bangs on the door from the housekeeper asking me "is it time for me to clean". I said excuse me? She goes "You checked out yet?" CLEARLY not. It's not check out time and I'm still in the room. This was such a disruptive experience in total. The idea of this hotel is cool and modern, but please teach your desk a thing or two about the importance of good customer service. This is my first and last time staying here.

title: FiDi is for weekends too!
text:
We were a bit reluctant to stay downtown over the weekend, since the financial district was always a ghost town on weekends when we used to work here 30 years ago. Boy have things changed - for the better.

First off the Moxy NYC Downtown is a great hotel with a cool, hip vibe, and the staff were phenomenal. Kevin, Michelle, Destiny, Ralph and the rest of the team really made us feel like we were the only ones that mattered whenever we asked for anything, even though many other people were also in need of support at the same time. I'm sure that they extended that same professional, cheerful and helpful attitude to the other hotel guests as well.

The World Trade Center, South Street Seaport, and Battery Park are all an easy stroll away.

NYC is really much more friendly and fun than it was when we lived here. Nearly everyone we met along the way helped to make our weekend getaway a huge success and a really fun time.

We will be back soon, and will strongly consider staying at the Moxy again. You should, too!

title: Quirky, fun, great staff!
text:
Stayed here with a significant other over the last weekend and we had a great time. It has lots of great, quirky offerings like a half-basketball court and skee ball. The rooms are tiny but really nicely made.

Also want to make a shoutout to Noelle who went out of her way to make our stay memorable. She managed to get us checked in early and catered to all our needs.

title: Interesting and Fun but Not Ideal if You Need Desk/Counter Space
text:
This was my first stay at a Moxy.  It was either the Moxy of the aLoft down the street.  I have stayed at my share of aLofts.  I wanted to try this one + it is newer and a little closer to Broadway.  I was kind of worried since this hotel is not for my age group :-)  

The location of the hotel is very convenient - just off Broadway and 1.5 blocks from the Fulton Center Subway + 3ish blocks from the WTC/PATH and a little more from the East /Hudson River ferries.  There is food near by - whether convenient/drug stores, fast food, fast casual or real restaurant.  

There are 2 check-in positions on the first floor's tiny and often crowded "lobby".  There is also a desk on the 3rd floor bar area.  The gym is on the 2nd floor - small but works.  Water fountain does not work too well there.

The 3rd floor is cool - has a small basketball court, some games and a big bar.  Not sure what food is served (but it does serve some food).  Saturday night there was noisy and full of people.  It is a beautiful and interesting space.  I guess different people will find different uses/lack of benefit for the space.

Reserved a King room and got one facing the south (i.e. no bridge view).  However, it was on a higher floor (I am a Marriott Titanium) so the view was good.

I was concerned with the size of the room.  However, since I travelled light on this trip, did not even bring a computer and was there only 1 night, it was OK.  For longer trips, I think the biggest problem for me would be the lack of desk/counter top space.  The fold-up desk is small, the small nightstand does not even have a clock, etc.  

There was also no decent chair if you were going to work on that little desk.  I think the concept is you go downstairs to work on the computer but that space is noisy, not designed for working on the computer and no privacy.  

The bathroom is great.  Nice sized shower with both on-the-wall and handheld shower heads, nice thick towels and even came with hand-washing liquid soap!  Dispensers for dual use shower/hair soap and hair conditioner.  No lotion provided.  Tiny ironing board and safe under the bed.  No sign of any ice bucket.

Lighting and blind controls are cool.  Bed was comfortable.  Staff is friendly.

So, I was happy with my stay and would definitely stay here again on quick non-business trips.

title: Great service
text: Had a great stay at the moxy Destiny was such a big help and very pleasant to deal with. Kevin also was very accommodating and went out his way to insure we had a great stay. Great staff I would stay again

title: I can see the appeal but not for me
text:
Stayed for a couple of nights on business and there were a few REALLY irritating things that would make me not stay here again.
1) Air conditioning in the room - It's like trying to sleep on an aeroplane. It is SO noisy I've never experienced anything like it. 
2) Lifts - There are lifts from the check-in desk to the lobby. They worked OK. There are 3 lifts from the lobby to the rooms. They are incredibly slow and for whatever reason on the first morning I was there I gave up after waiting for about 10 minutes for a lift that wasn't full and instead elected to walk. The lifts are incredibly slow and I don't think can service the hotel rooms fast enough in busy periods.

On the plus side, the breakfast was good except they'd run out of Oat Milk by 7.30am oh and there no room service from what I could tell.

I found the whole hotel atmosphere just a little bleak and uninviting. I think I'll go somewhere else next time.

title: Loved this place!
text: A perfect located hotel at Manhattan. Right behind Fulton Center, Century 21, WTC and a lot of bars.  Excelent service and supernice rooms. There was a lot of fun stuff in the bar area and the hole family loved to stay here. Chose this hotel for a perfect stay!

title: STUNNING
text:
Il Moxy New York Downtown,non è un albergo normale, è un albergo spettacolare.Gia appena arrivi vieni accolto da ragazzi gentilissimi e super sorridenti .
Per arrivare alla camera si passa dal bar , favoloso , arredato benissimo ,pieno di energia ,e con musica bellissima .Ogni volta che ci passi merita una sosta 
 La camera aveva una vista mozzafiato e la connessione internet è la più veloce che ci sia . L'albergo si trova nella zona più bella di New York,e sicuramente lo consiglio a tutti quanti e sarà il mio albergo newyorkese per tutta la vita
Complimenti avete creato un posto meraviglioso.

title: Great Stay at the Moxy
text: Great place, super clean, new, close to everything WTC, Wall Street, Little Italy and Chinatown. We spent a night at the bar which was relaxed and had a great vibe. The staff was great and took care of all of our needs including fixing a scooter for my disabled mother. Rooms are a bit small but that is NYC and especially in that prime area. Would definitely stay there again.

title: Kevin rocks!
text:
Keving is such an amazing agent. His check in experience was so amazing. He greeted me with a welcoming smile and made me feel like he known me for years. He is so genuine and nice it was so comfortable. Being a agent at a marriott myself it felt so good to get treated like that. We put me on a high floor and a nice room. Kevin is a great face for marriott and i hope to meet him again when i come back to new york. I came there from boston and was only there for the night from friday until Saturday. I told him im the torylanez look alike famous comedian and we had some good laughs about it. Glad to make a new friend at that property as i love that hotel and its amazing amenities. Ill be back soon not just because of the hotel but also because of the amazing staff at this property. 

-Donald Kelley-

title: This place is Dope!!
text: This place is Dope what hotel has a basketball court a DJ and a great bar!! Kevin is awesome and very helpful as is Michelle! Explained details of the hotel amenities and suggested me nearby restaurants to try💯 ..will be staying again soon !!

title: Girls weekend!!
text: This hotel is everything you need! From the front of the house staff to the amenities of the hotel. Kevin was super accommodating and made sure he met all our needs (and wants), contributing towards the perfect NYC weekend! Michelle assisted as well, ensuring that we had the best possible check in. Thanks to those two we had a great start to our weekend adventures! Thank you Kevin and Michelle!

title: Great customer service
text: My family came here last minute after leaving our original hotel. The customer service here is top of the line. Noelle at front desk was extremely helpful and accommodating. The rooms are nice. This was a great stay. Definitely recommend staying here at MOXY downtown. They also have a great bar !

title: Excellent service by Bill, Maria & Michael
text: Stayed at the Moxy for 2 nights and the hotel staff is outstanding. Very personable to us as guests. I had a scooter delivered and they offered to house the scooter in their storage room till next day. When they went to bring to me it would turn on but would not go in gear. After several attempts to reach the rental company, they called back and the staff followed their instructions to fix problem and I was on my way to see the city. Most other hotels would have left to me to get it resolved but not the staff at the Moxy. I have not met one staff member at this hotel I have found to be anything but pleasurable and wanting to please their guests. I’m an old grandma who would adopt them all!

title: Recreation Bar at Moxy's Downtown
text: If you're downtown near FiDi (Financial District) NYC, do yourself a favor and stop by Moxy downtown and grab a cocktail at their signature Recreation bar with a super dope atmosphere and chill mood. Food is great also,but the premier experience is my Man Antonio behind the bar, who's mixology/bartending experience is second to none and will tailor-craft a cocktail to your taste palatte and amaze you with tasty drinks you're not likely to find "just anywhere". Do yourself a favor and stop by and say hello, grab a drink and have yourself a great start to your evening/night. Just remember to tip generously....the best part of our stay at the Moxy. ☆☆☆☆☆

title: The Moxy is a GEM!!!
text: So impressed by this micro hotel by Marriott.  I cannot express enough how impressed we were by the design and attention to detail of the Moxy.  The lounge/bar area has a great vibe with fun lounge games or quiet sofa areas to enjoy a cocktail.  The rooms are small but everything you can think of is available to you.  Again, its all about design and the horizontal wall with magazine rack, tv, hangers, folding desk and chairs was ingenious.  The bathroom and shower are very spacious; and the beds/pillows were very comfy.  My one complaint is that there was no moisturizing lotion available in the the bathroom.  Literally, that is my only complaint!! This was exactly what we needed for a fun NYC weekend:)

title: I really wanted to rate this place higher but could not
text:
I am a long time Marriott rewards member and loved it when they started adding other brands to their company. I love the Moxy brand and I have previously stayed at the Moxy at Time Square. This place has the same vibe and feel to it but the execution was sorely lacking. The elevators here are substandard. There are only 2 elevators to service the rooms(there are actually 3 but 1 is a service elevator). Repeatedly and different times during my 4 night stay, I had to wait 5 plus minutes to get an elevator and then stop at nearly every floor up or down.  I’ve stayed and many hotels and have not found this experience before...multiple times it took over 10 minutes from when I pushed the call button until I arrived at the lobby...about the time it takes from boarding the subway downtown to reach midtown!

Coffee...on day 1, I went to the lobby and being unfamiliar with food/beverage services, went to the bar and asked for a large coffee...the gentleman turned and poured a cup (they were out of lids)and handed me a slip for $3 which I paid and didn’t think any more...until day 2 where I walked up and noticed that there were urns of coffee at the end of the bar self-serve- gratis as being a guest!  

The location to the subway (Fulton station is right around the corner and the court station is a 5 min walk for other lines) makes getting around easy. Not as many restaurants as Chelsea and Times Square areas and things close up around this location early as it’s very near Wall Street. Rooms are well laid out and maintained.

Still love the Moxy Brand and will stay at Times Square location (done that multiple times) or try the Chelsea location but I can’t see why I would stay here again based on my experiences.

title: Great vibe
text: Such a great property! Design details made this the most Instagramable hotel we've been to in a while - in-room swing with a fantastic view, open concept bar with ski ball, and an indoor basketball court? Yes please!! Staff was friendly (manager opened the bball court for us late-night and it was a BLAST) everything was clean, and the complimentary drink chip at check-in was a great touch. Can't wait to go back!

title: Just what you need to to see NYC!
text: The Moxy was just what myself and my son needed for his much anticipated graduation trip to NYC. The room was small but cozy, bath room facilities were great and the Decor had pizazz. The location is to die for... right in the heart of the city 5 minutes walk from the 9 11 memorial and great access to various subway and bus routes and food!. Also close to all the hop on/hop off bus tours if you want to be tourists like we were. Big up to Kevin at the Front desk! he made the trip memorable by being very knowledgable and helpful... highly recommend it!

title: Awesome stay - super cool with a 13 year old to play on the basketball court.  Natalie in Recreation was amazing!
text: Great stay! Cool rooms and amazing lobby with video games and basketball court.  Close to Wall St, One World Tower, and Seaport.  Take the Staten Island Ferry for free to see Statue of Liberty!  Definitely recommend for family.

title: Advertises as a Marriott Property, but extends NONE of the BonVoy benefits
text:
If you are a loyal Marriott member DO NOT STAY here.   As a Lifetime Titanium member, I am use to good service from Marriott properties for my 30 years of loyalty to the brand.

This place is the exception to the rule, we received a super tiny room, no in room water, no upgraded internet, no points, and no breakfast.

I email customer service, they said this property does not participate in the BonVoy program, and sent me 20 pages of fine print to the program, I never did find the citation that they don't participate.

Additionally the front desk staff is downright rude!

If you love Marriott this is NOT the place for you.

title: Fantastic Experience
text:
My wife took my daughter and a couple of her friends to NYC for my daughters birthday. The staff at the Moxy was fantastic. They took such good care of them. They went so far as to put up personalized birthday decorations for my daughter in her room.
The girls got home last night and were all grinning from ear to ear. They thought the hotel was funky and very cool, and definitely was a huge part of their NYC experience. 
We have already told several people about the experience and recommended the Moxy for their next NYC stay. 
Thank you again to the Moxy. Well played. 
You’ll be seeing us again soon.

title: Small Hotel Room That Maximizes It’s Tiny Space
text:
Great location and fabulous hotel! Walking distance to trains, WTC memorial and shopping.
For the average traveler, hotel rooms don’t need to be that big; as long as we have the essentials in them.  That’s what I found at the Moxy NYC Downtown. The furniture choice, absolutely a good idea in a small space.  For instance, convertible furniture for seating and table use. The hardware use for hanging clothes, etc.  Loved it!  The simple modern decor helped the room feel more spacious. 
Also, I appreciated the level of security- the guest key allowed access to the floor checked on.
The only thing I missed was a clock😉

title: Funky brand new, upmarket Hotel
text: Once we actually located the Moxie The Uber driveer tried to drop us off in Fulton St its actually on the other side which is Ann st. Check in was very fast no trouble at all.  You take the Elevator to the third level  where you would find a Funky bar and lounge along with Basketball court and other amenities. You then change Elevators to find your Floor and Room.  The music is pumping on a Sat and Sun night with a DJ. The room was immaculate. Small but we had three suitcases and we never tripped over them once. The bathroom is tiled in grey which is more pleasing to the eye with lovely modern sink glass shower doors shelves  a large up closs well lit Mirror and a Hairdryer that actually blows. The bed was very comfortable. Wifi extremely fast and free and alot of usb plugs for everyone. automatic shutter button. We were on the 28th floor and had a great view of the Brooklyn harbour bridge.  The hand soap lovely as was the shower and Conditioner in the shower from "MUK" There is a dressing gown that you can use as well as a Tote bag, you can also buy these. A great Location walking distance to Brooklyn Bridge, Subways, World trade centre, Ground Zero.  Loved this hotel all time fav

title: Moxy NY Downtown
text: Gostei muito do Moxy e recomendo para todas as pessoas que vão a NY. No início pensei que por ficar em Downtown talvez a localização não feria boa, mas se surpreendi. O hotel é novo, muito descolado. No saguão onde fica o bar tem vários jogos, e a galera do hotel como pessoas de fora vão para beber e conversar, em um estilo happy hour que vai até altas horas. O hotel conta com uma academia com aparelhos novos e uma quadra de basquete. O quarto que fiquei é minúsculo e não tem armário, então para quem viaja com muita mala não recomendo (ao menos que tenham outros quartos que eu não conheça o tamanho). Por ser um hotel novo, é tudo muito lindo. Fica algumas poucas quadras do World Trade Center, estação de metrô, Brooklyn, farmácia, restaurantes, lanchonetes. No quarto o banheiro é com aquecimento a gás, não tem frigobar nem cofre, mas tem secador de cabelo. 🤣

title: Great hotel and even better location
text:
When I booked this, I wasn't sure about the location as the financial district always felt kind of dead on the weekends but things have changed since I lived in NYC!  Lots of places to eat nearby and best of all, almost every subway line accessible within about a 2 block radius.

Hotel has the lounge on the 3rd floor so you check-in on ground and go up to 3.  The bar there gets hopping in the evening (there's a DJ) but we stayed on the 22nd floor so we were not disturbed by any noise.  

Rooms were thoughtfully designed as they were small but still had everything (e.g. the desk was a pull out from the wall so it was available if you wanted it but didn't take up any room if you didn't intend to use it).

Staff uniformly great across the board.  Shoutout to Kevin for his help trying to get us into our room early when my son turned up sick...so very kind and helpful (it didn't happen but the effort and cheery attitude was appreciated).

If you stay, head around the corner to Pisillo for a panino (they are huge with the freshest bread) or an espresso...real Italians!

title: Amazing surprise!
text: What a pleasent surprise. A friend recommended Moxy so I brought my boyfriend for his birthday. What a cool hotel! The bar space, the cool fun rooms,the lighting the views. Moxy is thw future. Noelle helped me check in. He was super helpful and made me feel welcomed.

title: Safe & Interesting
text: I flew solo on this trip & was a little nervous, but The Moxy eased my mind. It offers a great location... near WTC, municipal buildings, Fulton St. subway station. It was a brief 10 walk to the seaport, which I highly recommend. It's close to Wall Street & shopping... I walked to Trinity Church for some great photographs. It was cool & inviting. Great cocktails & night life! I cannot say enough good things. It you ate travelling alone, it's a safe place with easy access to so many things.

title: 최악의 호텔
text:
매리어트 공홈에서 예약
뉴욕의 호텔비 비싼것은 이해하지만 서비스는 진짜 엉망임. 조식당이 없으면 조식패키지는 왜 예약을 받는지 모르겠음. 조식 포함으로 받았으면 식사준비를 해야하는데 연락 받은게 없다고 별도 자불하고 먹으라함. 환불요청하니 자기에는 환불정책없다며 메리어트에 전화하라고함. 메일 보냈는데 일주일째 답 없음. 이게 메리어트 정책인지 의심스러움. 
객실내 옷장이 없어서 입던옷 벽어 걸어둬야함. 입던옷 걸어두고 그 먼지 다 먹어야함. 호흡기 걱정되는분, 아이동반은 절대 비추. 3층 로비은 오후 5시난 되면 클럽으류 버뀌어 너무 시끄러움. 객실엔 물도 없고 물과 커피는 아침에만 로비에서 마실수있음. 컨시어지에 동양인 여자는 동양사람한테 인사도 안하고 처다보지도 않고 매니저인 여자는 한술 더 뜸. 
Moxy의 컨셉은 불친절을 통한 인내심 키우기임. 
편안한 쾌덕한 호텔 시대하면 이 호텔은 절대아님. 
1점도 아까운 호텔 !!!!

title: Kevin is awesome
text: My stay at the Moxy downtown was great special shout out to Kevin for taking care of us during our stay!! We loved the bar and dj was amazing we will definitely come back and recommend this hotel to others.

title: Quirky & Fun
text: I wasn’t sure we picked the right place to stay when we entered the lobby and checked in. It was very a very small check in area. We got in the first set of elevators up to the 3rd floor where we would transition to another elevator. The 3rd floor lobby isn’t great. A nice open bar area with free skee ball and other activities. In the evenings there was a DJ playing great music. There is even a half court for basketball. Our room was pretty big for NYC standards and had a great view. Granted we were on the 1st floor. Overall we were very pleased with our stay.

title: Would stay again and again and again!
text:
Spending the night at the Moxy. Headed to lounge until my room ready. The bartender was super friendly and offered suggestions as to what drinks I should try. He has been attentive But not too obtrusive. The lounge area is clean and set up with private tables or long tables for community sitting. There is an old  PacMan game, skew ball and table hockey. 

The drink: margarita was good, could have been a little spicier for my taste. I ordered size garden salad which was OK, not great.

The front staff were very friendly, offering suggestion on places to eat.  Always said hello upon entering.  

Room was small but comfortable.  Design elements were both functional and looked aesthetically pleasing. For example, there was a folding stool that hung on the wall, it could be used as seating but also as a nightstand.  Rooms clean, products in bathroom high quality.   Great view of the Brooklyn Bridge only wish my room was up a few floors!

title: Micro room, but fine for one night
text:
We had trouble at check-in, they didn't know which rooms were ready due to a housekeeping computer glitch. It was after 3pm and we had to wait around, with NO help for over 30 minutes. We had tickets to a baseball game, so needed to get into the room. There wasn't even an offer of a free drink while we waited. The woman that "checked" us in, never came to tell us our room was ready-BAD start. No acknowledgement of titanium status at all. It is also in an alley which was full of trash, but the hotel is nice inside. 
The room was VERY SMALL, the smallest I've ever stayed in, ever. We only stayed one night- not sure we could have fit a suitcase in the room. They use the space well, it was very quirky and nice, bed was comfy and it was clean. I would not recommend the queen room for two people for more than one night, you cannot even get around the bed. We did get a great deal ($108), so it was worth being cramped. It is also very close to the 9/11 museum &  subway station- so it made our trip easy, and affordable.

title: Not Poor But not Average either
text: The room was clean, well organized and comfortable. Many reviews complain about the size, it is small but the pictures are accurate. The bathroom is a good size. The halls were warm & dark. I am not sure if the halls are air-conditioned. I know that they are going for a nightclub vibe type hotel but (IMO) it's weird and they should light the hallways for safety purposes. The biggest reason for the Poor review is that the air conditioning unit was EXTREMELY LOUD. So loud that I had to turn it off for my daughter to fall asleep but then I had to turn it back on because it's July in NYC & you need air conditioning!  Even when the one in your room turns off you can hear the noise for ones in other rooms. Ridiculous! I called the front desk around midnight asking for earplug & got them about 45 minutes later. That was disappointing. They helped some. They need to address the air conditioning issue. Also, the lobby smelled. I could not figure out if it was just from cleaning products & no AC in the lobby or what the smell was but it smelled. Gross. The internet & TV were out for our 24-hour stay & a previous poster said the same. I have never stayed in a hotel that cable was not working.  I called and asked & they said that it was being worked on all night & said it should be working but then called & said ...no it's not working yet. It could have helped w tuning out the AC noise or the noise from the street. I know its NYC but on the 22nd floor you don't expect much noise but there was night construction going on & when the AC turned off I had to hear the construction. I asked for a quiet room. If you are looking for a modern chic hotel & are not noise sensitive ...it's clean.

title: Modern, quirky, clean and great value
text:
Before I booked I read lots (good & bad) about the hotel & I'm so glad I booked it.  
Check-in: warm welcome, no queue & a room on the 27th floor (perfect!).  The view as you step out of the elevator is amazing.  

The Room: I knew it would be small but the use of space was clever.  No wardrobes & not much shelf space, but had loads of hooks so I took bags to put stuff in to hang (shoes, accessories, etc).  I packed our toiletries in a big tub so we could keep it on a shelf & rummage when we needed to!  The beds are memory foam, there is space underneath for a case & a drawer with safe in it.  The room was very clean.  There is a sign to say if you want the room serviced and this was done each time.  Only down side was that the controls for the lighting and shade seemed to have a mind of their own.

The young staff bring energy, we found them welcoming and helpful.  They held doors open and made casual conversation with ease (the only person we found less than helpful was an older bar tender who was abrupt in telling us we could help ourselves to tap water even though we were buying beers too).  
Coffee is free from 6.30-9.30am at the end of the bar.  I had read that you got drinks on arrival - this now only applies to members - but when I inquired, the girl on reception gave us 2 as a courtesy, which was a nice touch!
The location is perfect for downtown and anywhere else for that matter if you use the subway.
We would return in a heartbeat!  Well done Moxy Downtown, we miss you already!

title: There's a reason this is one of the cheapest hotels in Manhattan...
text: PROS: new, good location, walk-in showers and hip and trendy feel and vibe. CONS: TV and internet was out the majority of the second day of our stay, absolutely no communication or contact from the staff and of course no offer of any compensation of any sort. Tiny rooms, mostly with little to no view. In addition to all of the other disastrous Marriott changes and they are gutting of Starwood programs and benefits, they're moving completely away from bottled water at any of their locations and during our two-day stay I asked for different people and got four different answers about whether or not the water in the hotel was filtered or not. There are no signs nor communication in any way shape or form. Sometimes elevators are very slow, the food selection is scant at best and cocktails incredibly overpriced. I can't say enough bad things about Marriott's takeover of Starwood despite the expanded brand selection but none of it will ever make up for Marriott's gutting of the Starwood privileges that built the brand.

title: Extraordinary stay
text: First of all, big thanks to Team Kevin and Michelle!! They checked in me and my family very quickly and patiently shared the amenities that Moxy provided and they were spot on. We loved every minute of our stay there. Short but amazing with all the amenities mentioned games, music with DJ, lounge setting and great food.. Trust me, I will be back. The vibe and culture was awesome.

title: Bad customer services with nice facility and location
text:
Lowlights: Bad customer experience and lack of organisation/cleanliness. Don’t think/believe in this 4 stars hotel. Let me share my unlucky experience by naming few events: allowing a drunk guy sleeping in front of your door (security?), cleaning without schedule (do your housekeeping by yourself?), promises to contact you to provide any feedback/customer service (none, they don’t care about customers). Overall experience in this hotel: miserable! Go and find another hotel with proper experience on how to attend guests.

Highlights: location, lounge, games, food and drinks.

title: in and provided stellar customer
text: Great hotel near FiDi, with a very cool bar setup. The bar even has an indoor basketball court. The rooms are small (as to be expected in the area), however they are clean and very modern. I found the bluetooth speaker to be a great plus. The staff overall was very friendly. A special thanks to Kevin who checked me in and provided stellar customer service!

title: Like AC on a hot summer day? Steer clear of this place.
text: This hotel boasts about its air conditioning, but its AC can't keep up with a relatively mild 88 degree day. I'd hate to see it on a real sweltering summer day. Tried to get the front desk to help, but apparently they can't hear callers using in-room phones. If you're looking for a room in the financial district, skip this hotel and head to the Doubletree Financial District instead.

title: A glorified dorm room
text:
First off, the hotel was all the things a hotel should be: clean, safe, and reasonably furnished for sleep. 

Perhaps the Moxy concept just isn’t for me? I found the rooms to be like glorified college dorm rooms, or a fancy hostel masquerading as a hotel. There’s self check in, which I started to use only because both front desk staff were busy. But then I wasn’t making any progress, a desk agent became available, and instead of offering to check me in, she just shouted instructions to me from across the lobby. 

The room is small, which is no surprise because it’s New York, but it’s not super functional - corners are cut where they don’t need to be. For example, there is a a wall full of hooks upon entering, and chairs and a luggage holder are hanging from them. There are empty hooks, but no ironing board. The ironing board is under the bed, folded in half. Oh, and it’s a tabletop ironing board, which I’ve not used since college. The table hangs on the walls, you pick it up, and a kickstand drops to hold the tabletop up. It’s a little complicated when an ironing board would fit in the room. 

Noise in the hallways was a mild issue depending on volume of traffic. There’s no carpet to dampen noise. The city was performing some sort of sewer maintenance until 1 or 2am each night, which for a street-facing room was unacceptable. It felt like I was inside a subwoofer. 

None of the items I plugged in at night charged, either by USB or regular AC plug. That was a huge inconvenience, but since I wasn’t sleeping well due to street noise, I didn’t oversleep. 

After one night, I changed rooms. 

There’s no alarm clock, no apparent guide to the area or the hotel amenities (if they even exist). Nobody said if there was a gym where it was.

I’ve never stayed in a hostel, but this is what I’d imagine. The room decor will not age well. The water pressure in the shower was too low, but in the sink it was too high. 

I won’t be back to another Moxy.

title: Wonderful!
text: This review is mostly for the front desk management team—Kevin is absolutely fabulous and will go above and beyond to make you feel at home and ensure that your stay is amazing. I mentioned that I am taking a bar exam the next morning and he immediately ensured I was moved to a quieter room. Couldn’t ask for more. Exactly the service you would expect from a high-end hotel. Thank you so much, Kevin!!!

title: New, modern
text:
Location of hotel downtown is great, 1 block from Fulton St. Subway station, offering easy connections uptown and over to Brooklyn. 
The shared space lobby with their bar and restaurant is an ideal working space within the hotel. Lobby also has a 'convenience corner' of drinks and prepackaged food, which can be purchased at the bar. 
Rooms are small, but nicely furnished, but don't have some of the amenities you'd see in other hotels (no iron, or ironing board, no fridge, no closet) Closet is set as an open wall plan as you walk in. Some items located in room (robe, reusable bag) have price tags on them so you know the charge ahead of leaving if you choose to take it with you!
Floor to ceiling windows, with electronically controlled shade. Cool artwork located in rooms and through lobby. USB ports located in outlets throughout the hotel are a nice modern touch. 
My only real issue here was the water pressure on the 18th floor. It was not great. Bathroom was in line with room. Basic amenities available. Shower would have been much nicer with better water pressure. 
Staff can occasionally seem a little slow, but overall have been good and are responsive to guests requests and queries.

title: Amazing views from the room, even more amazing and friendly service from hotel staff
text: After staying at Moxy Chelsea, I decided to try this hotel for our anniversary with my wife. Amazing location and again unorthodox but thoughtfully designed rooms. Even though it is very casual establishment but the quality and helpfulness level of the staff is top notch (Staff makes everything in their power to help guests) Special thanks to Kevin and other team members to made this anniversary unforgettable for us. I can't wait to go back and stay here again.

title: False promises and advertising
text:
We were excited to check out Moxy Downtown on a rare night to ourselves in NYC, but were disappointed to learn that the hotel and its staff were not prepared to deliver on what the brand promises online as far as guest experience.  

We were off to a rough start when we arrived at 3:15pm for a 3pm check-in to learn that our room was not ready. 2 hours later, we were finally in a room....we were given extra chips for drinks at the bar and a breakfast coupon for our inconvenience. At that point, we had plans and were off to a late start, but figured we would be able to use the drink tickets and enjoy the common areas/games when we returned to the hotel after our show. Nope.

We returned to the hotel before midnight and went to the bar to learn it was closed. The game rooms and common areas were also no longer available for use. This was a surprise since the website outright says that guests can expect "the bar is always open and the crew is always on". There was no manager to speak with onsite and the crew was definitely not on. At this point, we had no choice but to retreat to our room and use a room key adorned with the phrase "Play On" to reinforce the disconnect in our experience and how this hotel is marketed/branded.

title: Cute & Hip but very “Tiny House”
text:
Very small room, even for NYC. (I think if you book through a discount site they give you a small room.) But the room was clean and had nice big windows for good light. Perfect for one adult, or an adult and a child. Two adults that are not claustrophobic may be ok... The furniture is all space-saving... stools on the wall, tables that fold away, small sink, no closet. Good use of the small space. My teenage daughter thought it was cute. There was no mini fridge, which was a shame. 

Self check in did not work. (Again, I believe this is because I booked through a discount site.) There were only two pillows in the room. It was hard to get someone to answer the phone, but when I got hold of the crew they brought a ton of pillows. 

Overall it was a good stay. Most things went smoothly and the location was perfect for our needs. The Recreation restaurant/bar played ultra-hip music. Great place for the young, single professional crowd.

title: SO IN LOVE WITH MOXY!!
text: I never review hotels and I have been in a lot of them. This was the best experience I have had in a very long time. Everything about my stay was perfect, from the excellent service at the front desk, to all the amazing amenities and the room, oh my god so adorable and the view was amazing!! Around the corner from just about everything, like Stone St the oldest street in NYC, Seaport, the Brooklyn Bridge, and Joes Pizza! The train is right around the corner also! Perfect!! Kevin and Rafael were awesome, very helpful and right on it with my bags, thank you!

title: welcoming staff, comfy beds
text: The Moxy was a great experience. The staff were very welcoming and the bed was so comfy! It looks very modern and location was great as well. Parking is the only thing that sucks about it but I love the space!

title: Trendy, Clean Hotel in Great Location!
text: stayed at the Moxy NYC Downtown during my trip to New York City last week and was super pleased with my experience! At their in-house bar, Recreation, they have these on-tap cocktails that tasted AMAZING! The bar space felt super comfortable and was filled with arcade sports and boardgames (we got to play life-size Jenga which was awesome). I really enjoyed my time at this hotel! The staff was super friendly and answered any questions I had right away. They even suggested some fun sights I should see during my time here! This Moxy hotel specifically was in a prime location for touring the area. We were able to walk to the World Trade Center and could see the Brooklyn Bridge from our room! Would definitely recommend for anyone looking to stay in NYC.

title: Location, location, location...
text:
This was a last minute online reservation a boy were we not disappointed with our choice. First and foremost, this hotel is very well situated.Steps away from the Fulton Subway Station which can take you anywhere in the city and beyond. Surrounded by great affordable restaurants of all kinds, coffee shop, spirits shop and a 24h CVS around the corner. 5-10  min walk to WTC and Brooklyn Bridge and 20-30 min walk to Battery Park, China Town, Little Italy and Cannal St for shopping. 
The staff was very friendly and helpful in all aspects of our stay. The hotel offers a hip and trendy open concept bar and lounge area with gym and basketball court.
Rooms are quite small but very well decorated and clean with free WIFI and cable TV.
You will have to pay for parking which is 50$ a day with the hotel discount and is also a few steps away.
Overall, very pleased with our stay and would not hesitate to stay at Moxy again.

title: 숙박비가 비싼 맨하탄에서 이용하기 좋은 호텔
text:
아무래도 보통의 호텔과는 좀 다른 컨셉을 갖고 있는 캐주얼 호텔 목시입니다.
SPG의 Aloft와 약간은 비슷한 컨셉이지만 좀 달라요.
Aloft NYC Downtown과 비슷한 위치라 처음에 택시기사가 Aloft로 데려다 줬어요 ㅎ

객실은 일본의 그것처럼 아주 작습니다.
그래도 출장길에 편안하게 이용했습니다.

방의 구조가 일반적인 호텔과 좀 달라서 낯설었어요.

title: Fantastic!!!!
text: From start to finish, The Moxy Downtown provided a stellar experience!!!  The front desk staff - super-friendly and very professional!  The gentleman opening the front door for us - made us feel like family!!  The rooms were impeccably clean and the view is beautiful!  Hanging out in the 3rd Floor Lobby - great arcade games, comfy couches - Nothing stuffy about this place at all!!!!  Strongly recommend!!!  I will definitely be back!!!

title: NYC Trendy Hotel
text: I knew being in downtown there would be more traffic, noise, and every view would be a building. They are in walking distance of so many things! The beds and pillows are comfy. Room was really clean. I needed more towels and I noticed some cleaning ladies were in the room next to me. I asked for towels when they had time and they got them right away with a smile. Not much room but is expected in NYC. The actual hotel staff was very hospitable, polite, opened doors, and always greeted us with a smile. Rafael was always willing to help with anything needed. He got us a car to take us to the airport, and stored our luggage while we went out in the morning before our flight took off. I think his name is James, the gentleman that opens the door during the day. He was the sweetest person ever! Always greeted us with the nicest, warm smile. Running into rude people on NY made out stay there even better!!! Thank you!!! Thank you to Syn, Maria, James, Rafael, Marcus and Noel for making our 1 week stay there such a great experience. Overall the hotel was a great choice to stay in. Strongly recommend!

title: Great location and amenities, fantastic service!
text: I had an amazing staycation at the Moxy NYC Downtown this weekend. The virtual check-in process was quick and easy. The rooms were gorgeous, clean and equipped with everything we needed for our stay. The bathrooms were also well-lit and spacious. I highly recommend checking out Recreation Bar in the lobby as well for some keg-tapped cocktails. The bar also has a ton of cool arcade games...including a basketball court! This is the perfect hangout spot for both guests and locals and the location downtown could not be better. I will definitely be back!

title: Decent hotel in a good location
text: Stayed at the Moxy Downtown for the first time. It’s a decent mid-range hotel with some food boutique touches. Nice beds, super clean and the rooms are a good size for New York where rooms are by default quite small. Location is perfect for getting around. Special shout out for Noelle and Kevin who are great front of house people-genuinely make the effort to make the experience a good one.

title: Great hotel, awesome staff, descent location
text:
My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights for my birthday. I am a platinum elite member for we had some perks. We got upgraded to the top floor which was nice, we also received a daily credit to use at the bar or restaurant.

Upon arrival the reception was a bit confusing and had a line backed up and out the front door. But once we were processed through, the main lobby area is up a floor. Here you'll find the bar/restaurant and some fun activities (skee ball, basketball court, shuffle board).

Then you'll take another elevator to your rooms. Rooms were very small (but you're in NYC) but functional. Pack light, there isn't too much space for that mighty suitcase lol. Bathrooms were very bright and showers were hot and spacious.

Food at the restaurant was pretty good, not many options, but I don't think they have a full kitchen. Bar was mediocre, prices were quite high for the area. 

All in all great stay. Staff was great. Would stay again!

title: Amazing Hotel with super friendly staff!!!
text: Best hotel in FIDI hands down. Beautiful hotel with amazing staff! Comfortable beds, beautifully appointed bathroom and super restaurant/bar! Staff is always willing to help! Very chic and hip space with a retro feel. My wife and I were treated like family. Will definitely be back and highly recommend!

title: Plenty of style; not enough execution
text:
The Good: great location, well styled, fun activities and lounge area.

The Bad: decent amount of street noise in the room (but it's NYC), charged $5 for coffee one day, then the other day it was free (who knows why).

The Ugly: weak execution of hospitality and what seems to be staff that haven't had to hustle in a well run hotel before (or who think doing the minimum is OK). I'm a long time globe trotter and a very loyal Marriott member and did not expect such weak customer service in such a big city hotel. Made an early request for the location of 2 rooms and the hotel was not prepared to honor upon check-in, room not cleaned without calling one day, had to call front desk multiple times to obtain simple items like ice, last time no ice was sent I used the App and went to the bar in person, asked to speak with the manager and she "did not have time" I was told! No one every got back with me in 2 more days at the hotel.  In the amount of time it took for the hotel staff to run back and forth asking about the ice, someone could have just taken a bucket and gotten it!  Come'on people.

title: Vibrant hotel; great staff; good location
text: This is a unique and vibrant hotel.  My sister, nieces and I thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay there.  The staff (Syn, James, Ralph, Mike, Kevin, Yazzy) were helpful and accommodating.  They immediately fixed a room problem (shade not working) by relocating us to another room and acted in a concierge capacity throughout our stay, directing us, printing out directions, subway routes, stations, boarding passes, etc. They also booked a car service for us to and from our airports which was helpful and reasonable.  Everyone there was helpful but these are folks that stood out.  Our room was very fun - a corner room with a view of the Brooklyn Bridge!  The bar area was neat and a great place to catch a drink or some coffee drinks (or complimentary coffee!).  We were all pleased with the room, service and vibe of this great hotel!  I'd like to come back for another stay. One small suggestion - put a trash basket in the bedroom area, not just the bathroom.

title: Business trip to NYC, a place to rest my head
text:
Staying here on a trip to NYC for business.  It was a short walk down to the WTC complex where the office is.  The area of NYC is really nice, and, of course, there is some significant history to take in here.

I got to the hotel pretty late in the evening, and with mobile check in, I was up in my room quickly.  Thing to note, from the street-level lobby, you take an elevator up 3 floors to their bar/social area, and then change elevators up to your room.  

I spent no time in the bar area, but it looked REALLY nice with a nice vibe.

The rooms are small and very minimal.  The bed was standard for a marriott property, very comfortable and I slept very well.  The rest of the room was not standard.  The only chairs were 2 stools that hung flat on the wall, and a suspended chair in a corner.  There was a desk that also folded down from the wall.

If you are looking for a place to work, this is NOT it.  Sitting on a folding stool using a folding table was not ideal.  Luckily, I didn't need to do that.

The bathroom was well a-pointed, the shower was very nice.  Interesting feature was a window in the shower that looked out over the bed area.  In the bed area itself there was a small piece of art that would slide over to close it off if desired.

The large windows facing the street had sheers on them, and an electric roll down blackout shade as well.  It took me a while to find the buttons as they were on the far side of the bed.

All in all, it was a great stay!

title: Best place to stay in FiDi! Amazing views, cocktails and amenities
text: I had the best time at the Moxy Downtown during my brief visit to New York. The rooms are spacious, modern, clean and featured everything to make my stay comfortable and easy. As soon as I got off of the elevator I was treated to a panoramic view of the Brooklyn Bridge and East River and my room looked out onto the Woolworth Building- a quintessential New York vibe. Recreation Bar in the lobby has amazing cocktails on tap which I’ve never seen before- highly recommended for a fun night! The staff were all very gracious and attentive. The location is within walking distance of 1 WTC and South Street Seaport. so very convenient for site seeing! I can’t wait to come back.

title: Small room, but great amenities
text: My husband and I stayed here while in town for a wedding this weekend. We previously lived in NYC, so we're pretty familiar with the city- the rooms are small by other cities' standards, but we found it pretty standard for NYC. I also will say the food is excellent and the bar is definitely one of the better hotel bars I've ever been to.  The only reason I wouldn't give this hotel a 4 or 5 star review was that our first night, we checked into our room and the AC clearly wasn't working- it was 77-78 degrees no matter what the AC was set to. We called the front desk when we got home for the evening and were told they would send an engineer up right away. After 40 minutes, no one had come- so we called down again and were told the engineer had left for the night, then the front desk person put my husband on hold for another 15 minutes. He finally went down and they switched us rooms- thankfully the second room had working AC but the new keys weren't programmed correctly- so we had to carry our stuff up and down the steps since the elevators don't work without keys. The hotel was cool and in a great location, but our experience with the staff left us underwhelmed.

title: Beware! Hotel staff attempted to steal our luggage!!
text: My husband and I stayed at the Moxy downtown for our wedding anniversary this past weekend for 3 nights.  While we knew that we were not going to get exceptional service from a hotel of this category, we certainly never expected to have the staff attempt to steal our luggage! Our flight yesterday was not until the evening and the hotel could only grant us a late check out until 3pm, so at this time we packed our bags and left them with the front desk clerk to store while we walked around for 1.5 hours to kill time before our flight. We each left a large suitcase and a carry-on bag.  Included in the carry-on bags were two designer handbags and a laptop.  When my husband and I arrived back at the hotel only an hour and a half later to pick up our bags and head to the airport, we were in for a real surprise. We waited for about 20 minutes for the front desk clerk to return with our bags before we began asking where she had gone as we were going to miss the airline’s checked bag cut-off if she did not hurry up with our bags. We were told at this point that they “could not find” our bags. We grew more and more frantic at this point, largely because we did not want to miss our flight. My husband asked to go down to the luggage room with the staff in order to look for the bags. He searched through both of the two luggage rooms and he did not see them. During this time, the staff kept coming out of the luggage room with suitcases belonging to other hotel guests. Everyone was getting their bags except for us. Knowing that we both had a lot of expensive items in our bags we became extremely suspicious and began getting very angry. We kept asking where our bags were but all the staff would say was “we don’t know” and they did not seem all that concerned to be honest. The assistant manager on duty then came out and went down to the luggage room to help look for the bags. When she did not come back up for another 20+ minutes, my husband asked to go back down to the luggage room again to find out what was going on. They said no, which made us more suspicious. We asked if there was any video surveillance that we could see and were told that the only video would be from the lobby and not in the luggage room itself. This would, however, at least allow us to see if our luggage had come out to the lobby and been provided to another guest (which we already knew was not possible as we had a claim ticket with a claim number and also I don’t think another hotel guest would just take off with 4 pieces of luggage not belonging to them!). Meanwhile, the front desk clerk who I had given the luggage tags to in order to retrieve our bags in the first place never came back up once and was not seen again during the entire ordeal. She also happened to be the employee who checked our bags in the first place. It is our opinion that this employee, whether acting alone or with other employees, intended on stealing our luggage (or specific items contained in our luggage). It was not until my husband became very angry and actually made it known he was on the phone with the police that our bags miraculously appeared, about an hour after we first provided the claim ticket to the front desk clerk. The assistant manager claims the bags were found in a “third luggage room” (they had only ever mentioned there were two luggage rooms during the entire ordeal) and said the bell man must have put them there because there was “no room” in the other two rooms. If this was the case, I highly doubt that they would not have searched this room at the start and I also highly assume that ours would not be the only pieces of luggage in this room. We firmly believe that an employee hid the luggage in this random room with the intention of going through the bags later in the day and taking items of value. The bags would then randomly appear back in the luggage room and the hotel would phone us to let us know they “found” our bags. And when they were returned back to us back in Toronto that is when we would discover our valuable items were missing. The assistant manager even tried to get us to leave to the airport while they continued to “search” for the luggage indicating she would contact us if they were found. She indicated the hotel would cover any costs to us for missing our flight, but our biggest issue was losing our luggage, not the flight. These were our personal items, many with important personal significance and these things cannot be replaced. It seems odd she would even consider this option. We were not leaving there without our luggage! We were very fortunate that our flight ended up being delayed by about 25 minutes. We actually missed the baggage cut-off even with the flight delay and we luckily were able to convince the airline attendant to put our bags through after much negotiation. We have never experienced anything like this in all our years of travelling. I should also mention that another hotel guest I encountered in the lobby during the ordeal told me that her necklace had been stolen from her room. So evidently theft is a common occurrence in this hotel. We certainly will never return. We are extremely disappointed in the way the assistant manager and the other employees handled this situation - they had no concern at all and did not even attempt to show remorse or be helpful. We will be contacting the manager and also intent to escalate things to Marriott. If you are considering staying at this hotel I highly suggest you find another hotel - there are plenty of other great options in the city. This place was nothing but a nightmare come true!

title: Awesome amenities
text: We enjoyed our stay in Manhattan and the Moxy was a great addition to our visit. The room itself is small but when you’re spending so much time out in the city, that’s not an issue. We enjoyed both the morning coffee and pastries a to start the day as well as the the bar and games at the end of the day.

title: Fun hotel worth the stay!
text: Stayed here one night while on vacation in New York. We had a queen bed room for 2 people, it was nice and clean. The room is not particularly big, but it was enough room for 2 people. The bathroom was spacious and the room included a little swing chair that you may see in photos. One thing I wish we had was a small fridge. The other amenities including the half basketball court, ping pong table, bar and arcade games really made the hotel stand out. You do get 2 drinks with your reservation and it was a fun time spending some time in the bar. Great location! Near a bunch of trains, the oculus and a shopping area. Financial district is far down NYC, but it was a convenient spot. I would stay again!

title: Clean, Quiet, Fun, Close to FiDi
text:
Great price to stay in a decent hotel in Wall
street FiDi area.  
Beds were comfortable.  Room was clean. I liked the cork floors. 
Motorized window shade was handy. 
Hallways were quiet.  AC worked great.  Lighting options ‘relax’ mode was useful.  Our bed had reading lights too. Hot shower, with hand held shower wand, a nice touch. Nice towels. Good supply of quality shower gel & hair conditioner in pumps - much better for the environment than those smaller bottles that other hotels give away. 
Shower had a peep hole - a window that you could cover - which was fun, but it’s not for everyone. 
We didn’t mind the hanging system, you have to take the stool off the wall to sit on it - for example  (also no closet - just hang your clothes on the wall) but we have older relatives who would not liked any of it. It might also be a pain if you have toddlers and you were tired after a long day of travel, but I guess it depends on your level of energy. The mini table folded on to the wall to get out of the way. Rooms are small - as others have said - but we didn’t mind, it was designed well, so it’s functional. Our room had a window that opens to get free air which is rare in hotels and can be a godsend if your room smells bad from food or whatever.  I think many of the rooms had windows that open. 
Our teen loved this hotel. It was hipster heaven. The staff was very nice and overall the hotel had good value.
WiFi in room was not strong. 
Free coffee in the mornings in Recreation bar/hangout on the third level. Recreation bar had drag races one night, a DJ, and a comedy night. We got 2 complimentary drink vouchers when we arrived. 
As others have mentioned - to get to your room you go up one set of elevators then walk across bar/Recreation then wait for another elevator. 
Only 2 of the 3 elevators were working but it never was a problem for us. 
Once you get the second elevator you have to swipe your room key to get to your floor - great for security but sometimes hard to do if you’re holding food etc. 
For those and other reasons I would say it’s not a great place to stay if you’re older, or if you’re high maintenance, or have mobility issues. Like some of my relatives.  They wouldn’t have been able to get out of the hanging chair. But we did see older people there so if you’re spry it’s certainly possible. The hotel might have wheelchair and limited mobility rooms with a different design - we didn’t ask.  The main hotel entrance and elevator was wheelchair-friendly. 
Staff was awesome - helped us print boarding pass, got us car service to airport, all of them were friendly and very knowledgeable.  
If you’re hungry you must try the Pusilli Panini place - very close to Moxy, giant Italian sandwiches. Read the reviews.
Close to Fulton Street subway, 24 Hour CVS, and plenty of restaurants.  
Thanks so much for everything Jhirette, Noelle, James & Ralph. 
We would love to stay here again if it doesn’t become too pricy as word gets out - it’s a new hotel, less than a year old.

title: Jong & trendy hotel - PERFECT
text: Moxy is een jong en trendy hotel op steenworp afstand van WTC. Het metrostation Fulton street ligt om de hoek waar je op vele metrolijnen kan opstappen. De kamers zijn trendy ingericht, zijn ruim genoeg, schoon en fris. Personeel is eveneens aardig en behulpzaam. Voor mensen die nog twijfelen; niet doen. Dit hotel ligt even uit de drukte op een perfecte locatie. Wij komen graag bij dit hotel terug.

title: Don t expect customer service
text: I stayed 4 nights in this trendy and contemporary hotel. Rooms are very compact, modular and functional which I liked. The cork floor and the interior is great and Adds some warmth to the room. I did miss a kettle there as it was very cold and it would have been nice to make a cup of tea. ....rather than ordering one 10 floors down in the lobby area and bring it back  to the room and only and to find out that the cup had lipstick marks on it. Other than that lobby- bar area is a really nice hub and great for having food, chilling or working and the bar staff was friendly there. The customer service overall was a big let down, I had to change rooms as I found lots of hair in my bed from the previous guest . I found that the staff had a bit of an attitude and didnt say sorry for the incident and making me move in my night gown ready to go the bed after long travel. Trendy, good location, but lacks cleanliness and customer service.

title: Tolles Hotel für einen Städtetrip!
text: Wir waren 5Tage in NY und fanden das Moxy perfekt, um NY von Downtown aus zu entdecken. Die Zimmer sind sehr klein und es gibt keinen Kleiderschrank. Daher einen Punkt Abzug. Das Frühstück würde bei der Online-Buchung für 30$ p Person angeboten. Wir haben es nicht gebucht und waren immer in der Gehend frühstücken, was ich auch empfehlen würde. Ein Frühstücksbüffet gibt es im Hotel nicht! Das Hotel hat eine tolle, großzügige Bar mit verschiedenen Spielen, etc, so dass man dort gut Zeit verbringen und seinen Tag planen kann. Sehr nettes Personal.

title: If you are okay with poor service.....
text: I am a frequent traveler to NYC and this was by far the worst customer service I've experienced in any city hotel. It was an across the board indifference from everyone we spoke with. There is no coffee in the hotel room, so one day I went down to the lobby, got a coffee and then went to the bar to pay for it (cost twice what they charge at the Starbucks BTW). The bartender grumbled at me and said "next time get coffee there", he pointed across the room and walked away. I never saw another place to get coffee  and still have no idea what he was pointing at. Literally I could detail 5 different experiences that were just like that. I wish I could say there was one person who was kind or hospitable, but from the check in process to them storing our bags on the way out it was one cranky person after another. Add that to the cramped, excessively minimalist rooms and it definitely isn't a hotel I'd go back to.

title: A must stay
text: My husband and I stayed at the Moxy downtown last week (May 14- May 17th). I must say that it is a great hotel. The room was immaculate and we received service daily. The housekeeping staff was very attentive and friendly. Upon going to my next vaca I will definitely check to see if there is a Moxy hotel available to stay at wherever I go. Thanks for everything!

title: Great vibe, few confusions around management
text:
It’s in a cool location in the financial district and has a low key reception with self service check in.  This is fine but does mean you miss out on the opportunity to ask questions as there was always a queue at the tiny reception desk.

The bar is great with a retro look, lots of fun games and a programme of DJs and move nights.  The room we had was small but comfortable (very comfortable bed) and was perfect for a city break.  It was also nice to be able to access Netflix etc in the room. 

There was confusion over the breakfast being included in the room rate - they still haven’t refunded us for the breakfasts we had been told would be included but were charged to the credit card.

I would stay there again definitely, it’s not hugely cheap for the extras (breakfast and drinks), and there’s no room service, but with the excellent Joe’s Pizza round the corner we didn’t need it!

title: They charged my account 270 euros extra and have been ignoring my emails.
text:
tldr; They charged my account 270 euros extra and have been ignoring my emails.

While the hotel is good in terms of conditions, and the staff is really nice, the management of this hotel seems to be a mess.

I booked directly via the Marriott Bonvoy system as I has enough points to have 2 out of 3 nights free. They charged me for those two nights even though it's stated that I was supposed to pay $380 as per the bill they emailed me in advance.

The hotel hasn't been responding to my emails. I also started a claim via Marriott Bonvoy and that seems to be ignored as well.

So maybe if you really have to stay here make sure that you pay in cash or something as they seem to either have bad intent and charge you extra on purpose or not aware of the mess they're in in terms of their management which is crazy considering it's part of a big chain.

title: We'll be back!!! Lovely hotel
text: We were staying at Moxy Downtown for 6 days and enjoyed every minute of it. The location is perfect for exploring the city. And the room was perfect to recover the strength -very comfortable beds, sparkling clean throughout. Very friendly and helpful staff. Next time we are in the city surely will be coming back.

title: Outstanding Customer Service
text: Recently my husband and I traveled to New York (NY).  It was my husband's first time in NY.  When we checked into the Moxy, the hotel associate who checked us in was Yasmin.  She was very friendly, outgoing and offered several suggestions on what to do and where to eat.  She said that she wanted our stay to be memorable so she ensured that we had an outstanding room with an excellent view.  We had a blast in New York and Yasmin ensured that we started our trip on the right track.

title: Had a blast
text: I’m a native New Yorker and stopped by your hotel to check on some family visiting from Texas and their stay. Updated my arrival I had some trouble locating their room. The front desk was extremely helpful and directed my to the 3rd floor through the Recreation space. To my surprise, I stumbled upon an event mixer and I’m glad it happened. There were so many interesting people there amazing conversation, great drinks and really cute bites. I really enjoyed the 4 cheese flat bread and your server Laura was absolutely pleasant sweet & quite charming. The basketball area was awesome and extremely fun.  These type of events are a great way of networking in the downtown area where people can meet, exchange ideas, share a great time and I’m looking forward to coming back very soon and I’m definitely bringing some friends along. Although I’m recovering from the night I had to write to you guys and say job well done Moxy!

title: Watch your credit card
text: Be careful with your credit card for incidentals here. Someone tried to use mine for over $2900 at Rite Aid down the street after I left. Other than that, location was great. Tiny room didn’t matter. The bar area is a cool place to hangout

title: Under 30's ONLY
text: Really painful elevators. Just way too noisy for me. DO NOT like NOT having a desk to work on in my room. Just too tight a room for my comfort, Much prefer a traditional comfort 4 star experience . Hip hop for the 24s

title: Nice stay, good location
text:
Stayed at this place for 5 nights. Our rooms were sparkling clean and fresh. Housekeeping service was great, they change bed sheets and towels every day. Location is extremely good, after couple of minutes walking you can reach to many attractions and the metro is near too. The room is tiny but well equipped. (USB port, smart TV, wifi etc). Everything is clear and fresh. The lounge is friendly, and spacious.  
Easy check in and flawless check out. Wonderful location. I highly recommend this hotel to all types of travelers.

title: fun, trendy hotel
text: great location and super service, but too pricy for the size of the room and lack of amenities. Expected a microwave, fridge, and jacuzzi, but they did not have any of these! The service made up for it though! Front desk attendants were helpful and friendly. A perfect hotel for young people, and those young-at-heart!

title: Great stay
text: Stayed at this place for three nights with family friends. Our rooms were sparkling clean, fresh and spacious. Housekeeping service was great, they changes bed sheets and towels every day. Easy check in and flawless check out. Wonderful location. I highly recommend this hotel to all types of travelers.

title: Excellent!
text: Great hotel. Excellent room service. Very clean and comfortable room. Every staff member we came across had a smile and was very helpful and friendly. Everything from entering the hotel until leaving was great. Highly recommended.

title: Disappointed because it could have been good
text:
The hotel has s great location in a pleasant but busy area 3 or 4 mins walk from ground zero. 

Small lobby off the street and then a short lift to the bar. The bar is great but bar prices are sky high (but so is everything in this neighbourhood).

You then get a lift to your room from the bar.

The rooms are very small but it is New York. Staff are great but here are my issues.

1. Room noise facing the street was unbelievable. So got a room move. This was arranged easily but executed poorly.

2. The lifts are busy, especially in the morning. Allow 10 mins to get down.

3. Lift key cards temperamental and only allow access to your floor so tricky in a group (use the stairs)

4. Not a single vegan item in the hotel. Odd for somewhere trying to be cool.

On the whole it's ok but do not expect to be wowed.

title: Updated Review
text: I had posted a 1 star rating due to poor customer service from a double-booking mixup, but Jeff at the Moxy was kind enough to call me and make things right.  I look forward to staying at the Moxy sometime soon!

title: tiny room goes w perfect location
text: Location is extremly good, after couple of minutes walking you can reach 911 Memorial, Wall street etc and the metro is near too. The room is tiny but well equiped. (USB port, smart TV, wifi etc). Everything is clear and fresh. What i really missed is a closet, but it has no place to have. The lounge is friendly, and spacious. Good place to work (USB port, and electricity has been built in the table), but you can chill to.

title: Prime Downtown Lower Manhattan Location, Smart Furniture, Many Subways around
text:
Best for its location as its just walking distance to Wall Street, 911 Memorial, One World Trade Center, Subways, and several grocery stores. 

The room setup is smart design furniture which is typical nowadays in NYC due to lack of space and average room size getting smaller. 

Our room on 8th floor was super clean as if we were the first guests staying there, however smaller than expected. Though it had all the needed facilities one can expect from a budget hotel in a prime location except for the coffee maker! The queen bed was one of the smallest I have seen with only 2 Pillows.

The staff at the front desk was very hospitable and first introduced herself before explaining all the booking details including the incidental charges authorization.

The check-in and check-out experience was seamless. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit.

title: Clean, hip hotel in a great location
text:
What I liked about the Moxy downtown:
• Clean room, bigger than many in this price range (though still on the small side).
• Well appointed room, sleek and sexy.
• Bigger bathroom than most. In fact, a great bathroom.
• Quiet. Virtually no street noise from my room (13th floor)
• Multiple lighting options in both bedroom and bathroom -- from ambient to bright.
• Attentive, pleasant staff (Especially Stephanie and Rafael)
• Incredible location

What I didn't like about the Moxy downtown:
• The noxious, subway-like stench in the tiny check-in area you have to walk through before heading up to your room -- which, oddly, happened only at night (probably because in the two nights I was there, a sewage vacuum truck was right outside on the street, doing God-knows-what. Happily, though, that odor went away the moment I entered the first elevator on my way upstairs.
• No safe in my room.
• No dresser or closet in my room. Just a few hooks on a wall and small, retractable table to place your suitcase on.
• The ear-splitting, horrible DJ music blasting on the third floor both nights I was there. Not a huge distraction though, as that noise was completely inaudible as I went up to my room. Just a minor, have-to-pass-by-it annoyance to get to the second set of elevators that lead to the guest rooms.

title: It was a pleasure.
text:
The staff were amazing at this hotel even though I bothered them several times a day about travel adaptors, hotel amenities, General room issues (I couldn’t get the tv to work), housing keeping requests etc. 
If they could not help me they offered to help me find a solution about even where to find a grocery store or the like. This hotel rooms are small (although I am accustomed to large Australian rooms) the room was super clean, stylish and I loved all the little features like the old style telephone, beats audio through the tv. Make up mirror light. Muk products. I loved this hotel and service so much I booked to stay at the Times Square one a week later. Thanks so much for a great stay!

title: Cool concept and nice location marred by disorganization
text: Organization for checking in and out was disappointing. Disorganized booking system. The hotel did not have the booking confirmation I made through Booking.com even though I had received a confirmation by email. Staff was accommodating but the whole process took a long time and I had to be on the phone with Booking.com. Ended up missing a major train ride due to the process. I'm also a Marriott Rewards member and was told upon arrival the first night that they lost my preferred customer room as it was given to someone else. Had to wait over 1.5 hours at around 6PM (promised guaranteed check in time 3PM) to just get a regular room, low floor, no view, no perks of rewards membership. They didn't make up the room or service at all during this 2 night stay.

title: Amazing
text: What an amazing hotel. Staff is so friendly. If you’re in the area - the flatbreads OMGZ amazing. The basketball room on the floor with the bar is a ton of fun. There is also skeeball! Definitely coming again soon. What a great fun vibe.

title: great location ,close by main Fulton st  Subway 3mins walk to 9-11 Memorial Museum
text:
This is my first time stay @ Moxy NYC Downtown
me and my son spend spring brake April 18th-21st, we love the location easy to get around Manhattan,GREAT SHOPPING@21 century Store,Nice Bar for great cocktail and music.Friendly staff so helpful with big smile,special Thank you to Miss Yasmin at the front for the King room with View.also my 15 years old son love the B S ball court.we will go back and stay there again.
akom joe wilailuck

title: Great option for 2 people
text:
Came here for a long weekend celebrating my birthday (and, as it turned out, my engagement). I'm Gold Elite with Marriott, but unfortunately, there were no upgrades available when we checked in. All good, the staff was very kind every time we spoke. We used the drink chips they gave us at check-in on our last night. My prosecco was covered; my fiancé's cider was not. The games were fun. We came in after dinner on Friday night and the DJ was blasting Backstreet Boys. I loved it, my fiancé said in the elevator, "I am officially too old for this hotel."

Room is small, but I knew what we were signing up for. I LOVED the media system on the TV and how you can either manually sign out of all your services or you'll be signed out at checkout.
